title: Security Consultant
description:
WHO ARE WE?

We are a bunch of super enthusiastic, passionate, and highly driven people, working to achieve a common goal! We believe that work and the workplace should be joyful and always buzzing with energy!

CloudSEK, one of India’s most trusted Cyber security product companies, is on a mission to build the world’s fastest and most reliable AI technology that identifies and resolves digital threats in real-time. The central proposition is leveraging Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to create a quick and reliable analysis and alert system that provides rapid detection across multiple internet sources, precise threat analysis, and prompt resolution with minimal human intervention.

Founded in 2015, headquartered at Singapore, we are proud to say that we’ve grown at a frenetic pace and have been able to achieve some accolades along the way, including:

  • Launch of our first product in 2016.
  • Earning our pre-series A funding in 2018.
  • Receiving multiple awards including the prestigious Excellence Award for being the Security Product Company of the Year in 2020.
  • Receiving the Series A funding from MassMutual Ventures in 2021 with a total investment of $10million.


CloudSEK’s Product Suite:

  • CloudSEK XVigil constantly maps a customer’s digital assets, identifies threats and enriches them with cyber intelligence, and then provides workflows to manage and remediate all identified threats including takedown support.
  • A powerful Attack Surface Monitoring tool that gives visibility and intelligence on customers’ attack surfaces. CloudSEK's BeVigil uses a combination of Mobile, Web, Network and Encryption Scanners to map and protect known and unknown assets.
  • CloudSEK’s Contextual AI SVigil identifies software supply chain risks by monitoring Software, Cloud Services, and third-party dependencies.


Key Milestones:

2016:
Launch of our first product.

2018:
Pre-series A funding.

2020:
Excellence Award for Security Product Company of the Year.

2021:
Series A funding from MassMutual Ventures, totaling $10 million.


About CloudSEK:
 CloudSEK is a leading AI-driven digital risk management enterprise specializing in predicting and mitigating cyber threats. Our flagship product, XVigil, leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to provide real-time threat intelligence, protecting organizations from data leaks, credential disclosures, and other cyber threats across surface, deep, and dark web sources. We serve a diverse clientele, including top banks, technology companies, healthcare organizations, and retail giants globally.


The Security Consultant will be responsible for end-to-end technical value translation and problem resolution, working closely with various stakeholders. Excellent communication skills and a mature approach to engagements are essential for success in this role.

This is a partial technical role with customers responsible for solving product and cybersecurity-related problems of low to high complexity. You will act as a focal point for the prospect problem resolution for us and our clients.

Experience Level - 0-3 years

Freshers from a security background can also apply.


What Will You Do

  • Develop a thorough understanding of the various existing and future technologies and products developed in the CloudSEK portfolio.
  • Stay constantly updated with the latest in-house research and conduct your research on emerging Threat Intelligence (including vulnerability research, Threat actor TTPs, etc).
  • Have technical conversations with cyber security and business teams from enterprises and governments across the global markets that CloudSEK operates in or will operate in.
  • Accountable for end-to-end technical value translation and technical closures for all product evaluation engagements, augmented by a team of high-caliber researchers.
  • Closely work with multiple stakeholders, i.E. the product development teams, engineering teams, GTM teams (including sales, marketing, and business development), and revenue ops teams.
  • Stay updated on the Threat landscape and regulatory landscape of all regional markets the individual is responsible for.


What Are We Looking For

  • Offensive security mindset - The individual needs to have a strong fundamental understanding of web application security, a good understanding of strategic and tactical threat intelligence, and effective research skills to create and present a compelling chaining of detected and discovered vulnerabilities, exposed sensitive data/ parameters that is business consumable (understandable by a non-cyber security business audience).
  • A mature approach to engagements and strong communication skills.
  • Strong hold on the local language (Portuguese) as well as English.

title: Associate Actuary
description:
Since 1989, Best Doctors Insurance has been the leading international health insurance company in Latin America, the Caribbean, and Canada. At Best Doctors Insurance, we provide our members with the very best healthcare by delivering unique health plans of the highest quality. For over 30 years, our insurance products have been the premier staple in the industry and the standards we set;
along with a wide rangeof exclusive benefits, are the key differentiator in the lives of our members. With over 125,000 members worldwide, our health plans provide flexibility along with comprehensive coverage. Our team of specialists guides you through the complexities of the healthcare system while bringing you renowned medical providers for the utmost quality care.
POSITION PURPOSE:
Support Chief Risk Officer and Actuarial Function
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Help with the monthly claims reserving for general ledger reporting.Support with quarterly Board reports.Support product development and rating activities.Help analyze and recommend benefit changes to existing products.Contribute to the management and analysis of reinsurance portfolios.Support the creation and maintenance of experience studies for insurance portfolios.Assist IT colleagues with automation projects related to actuarial data and reports.Assist in audits related to actuarial estimates.Assist in annual rate reviews and financial planning assumptions.Research and suggest methods for portfolio optimization.Collaborate with underwriting and other business partners as needed.Contribute to regulatory filings for entities in the Americas region.
Requirements:

familiarity with VBA, SQL, R, or Python is a plus.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Spanish speaker and advantage but not required.

title: Head Of Marketing, Americas
description:
Kaspersky has been protecting individuals and corporate clients all over the world from cyber threats for 27 years.

We have 400 million unique users, 270 000 corporate clients, 517 products, 1100 technological patents and 34 offices around the world.


Today our team has more than 5 000 top level experts, all of them regular people with their own talents and hobbies.

Together we protect the world from cyber threats.


Join us to become part of an exceptional team, while remaining yourself and using your skills to keep us growing and evolving!


The Head of Marketing is the executive leader responsible for the overall strategy, direction, and execution of all marketing activities within the region. This role is pivotal in aligning marketing efforts with the company’s regional business objectives, enhancing brand visibility, driving revenue growth, and increasing customer acquisition and retention. The Head of Marketing ensures that the marketing department operates efficiently, innovates continuously, and supports the organization’s goals to maintain a competitive edge in the IT security market.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategic Leadership:
     Partner with the company’s overall marketing strategy, aligning it with business and long-term growth objectives. Lead the development of high-level marketing strategies for product, brand, demand generation, and customer retention together with the sales leadership.
  • Team Leadership & Development:
     Ensure that the team is motivated, equipped with necessary skills, and aligned with the company’s vision.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration:
     Work closely with the MD, sales leadership, product teams, and customer success to ensure marketing strategies align with broader company objectives. Act as a key advisor to senior leadership on marketing strategies and performance.
  • Brand Management & Positioning:
     Ensure the development and maintenance of a strong and consistent brand identity across all marketing channels and touchpoints. Oversee the creation of messaging that resonates with target audiences and strengthens market position.
  • Demand Generation & Lead Management:
     Oversee the development and execution of demand generation strategies to create a continuous pipeline of high-quality leads. Ensure alignment between marketing and sales to optimize lead nurturing, conversion rates, and customer lifetime value (CLTV).
  • Marketing Innovation:
     Drive continuous innovation in marketing strategies, channels, and tactics, including the adoption of new technologies and methodologies that enhance marketing effectiveness and customer engagement.
  • Budget & Resource Allocation:
     Develop the marketing budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources to high-priority programs and initiatives. Monitor spending to ensure alignment with organizational goals and ROI expectations.
  • Performance Monitoring & Analytics:
     Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of marketing programs, analyze results, and adjust strategies as needed. Provide regular reporting on marketing performance to the executive team.
  • Market Intelligence & Competitive Analysis:
     Lead market research and competitive analysis efforts to inform marketing strategies and ensure that the company stays ahead of industry trends and competitor activities.
  • Corporate & External Communications:
     Oversee all corporate communications, public relations, and media outreach to ensure positive brand perception and consistent messaging across all public channels.


Required Experience & Skills:

Hard Skills:

  • Education :
    Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field;
    an MBA is highly preferred.
  • Experience :
    10+ years of experience in marketing, with at least 5 years in senior leadership roles (e.G., VP of Marketing, Head of Marketing).
  • Marketing Expertise :
    Proven track record of developing and executing successful marketing strategies that drive business growth and market share.
  • Leadership & Budget Management :
    Experience in leading cross-functional teams and managing large, complex marketing budgets.
  • Marketing Specializations :
    Expertise in demand generation, content strategy, digital marketing, brand development, and customer retention.
  • Technical Skills :
    Familiarity with marketing automation platforms (e.G., HubSpot, Marketo) and CRM systems (e.G., Salesforce).
  • Industry Experience :
    Experience in the IT security, SaaS, or B2B technology sectors.
  • Certifications :
    Certification in marketing leadership, digital marketing, or data analytics.
  • Language Skills :
    Fluent English is mandatory;
    Spanish is desirable.

Soft Skills:

  • Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills to inspire teams and engage effectively with executives and stakeholders.
  • Strong strategic thinking, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities.
  • High emotional intelligence and the ability to influence and negotiate across departments and with external partners.
  • Results-driven with a deep understanding of how to measure, optimize, and scale marketing programs effectively.
  • Innovative mindset, continuously looking for ways to improve processes and stay ahead of industry trends.

title: M&A / Business Development Analyst (F/M)
description:
VINCI Highways , a VINCI Concessions subsidiary, is a leader in road concessions, operations and mobility services. We design, finance, build and operate highways, bridges, tunnels, urban roads and mobility services on a +3,000 km network in 14 countries. VINCI Highways leverages its expertise to deliver the highest performance and safety standards and provide drivers with a positive experience.


VINCI Highways is currently looking for a LATAM Business Development Analyst (F/M), based in Sao Paulo.


Reporting to a Project Director and/or Project Managers, you will be involved in project management, particularly in various LATAM countries, notably Brazil, for greenfield bidding projects for new concessions, as well as privatization or asset sales (M&A type) transactions. You will work on coordinating all aspects of the transactions - financial, legal, strategic, technical, operational, public relations...


Our future Analyst responsibilities in this position will be:


  • The Analyst will participate in the strategic identification of new investment opportunities and the implementation of the strategy established with top management, both through targeted acquisitions and green field projects.
  • In identifying and analyzing new opportunities, the Analyst, in liaison with the Project Directors, will be responsible for conducting preliminary strategic analyses, identifying concrete implementation cases and structuring partnerships.
  • During project implementation, the Analyst will be responsible for supporting Project Managers and Directors in all strategic, financial, operational and legal aspects of the projects.


Projects, the vast majority of which are abroad, can range from a few million to several billion euros in construction and operation.


The profile we are looking for :

  • Graduated from a leading French business school (or international equivalent) (HEC, ESSEC, ESCP, Dauphine, Sciences Po...) or engineering school (X, Centrale...), but also from a top Brazilian university (Universidade de São Paulo, Universidade Estadual de Campinas, Universidade de Brasília, UFMG, PUC Minas, PUC RIO).


  • Ideally, your diploma is accompanied by a master’s degree in finance or economics.


  • You have a first significant experience in a position where you have been exposed to business development, project financing, transaction services or M&A, preferably for infrastructure projects.


  • Dynamic, rigorous, open-minded, ethical, autonomous and organized, you are recognized for your ability to analyze and summarize.


  • Diplomatic, you enjoy working in multidisciplinary teams in project mode.


  • You are able to make proposals and provide advice.


  • This position requires frequent travel.


  • Fluency in Portuguese and English is imperative, and fluency in another language (Spanish or French) would be highly appreciated.


Local contract only.

title: Accounting Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a Accounts Payable Specialist to join our team in São Paulo and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.


Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we’ve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising €250M to revolutionize digital advertising.


Your Challenge

  • You will be responsible for handling vendor invoicing on a daily/weekly basis.
  • You will be responsible for Purchase order reconciliations (Invoice vs PO).
  • You will consider accruals/provisions booking at the month-end.
  • You will be part of the monthly AP closing accounting process.
  • You will actively collaborate in the Payment run process.
  • You will support and cooperate in Front Office inquiries:
    Email and phone support.
  • You will perform and engage following the department's KPIs and SLAs.
  • You will actively support the team in projects related to new market integrations and internal corporate projects.
  • You will be part of the automation and harmonisation of tasks within the team.


What You’ll Need to Succeed

  • Have a business management or finance-related degree.
  • Have between 1-3 years of a strong accounting background.
  • Are fluent in English and Spanish. Other languages would be an advantage.
  • Have thorough experience with spreadsheets and Excel.
  • Are attentive to detail and well-organized.
  • Possess strong prioritisation skills;
    flexibility and the ability to multitask daily.
  • Are not afraid to speak up, make mistakes, learn from them and propose improvements.
  • Have an international and multicultural mindset.


Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity:
A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility:
At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development:
Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture:
We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection:
Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!


Additional Perks

  • Flexible benefits plan:
    Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
  • Health insurance:
    Comprehensive coverage included.
  • Gympass:
    Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
  • Seedsave Program:
    Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.


Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!


At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

title: Software Engineering Platforms Principal Engineer
description:
Company Overview

Stellantis is a leading global automaker and mobility provider that offers clean, connected, affordable and safe mobility solutions. Our Company’s strength lies in the breadth of our iconic brand portfolio, the diversity and passion of our people, and our deep roots in the communities in which we operate. Our ambitious electrification and software strategies and the creation of an innovative ecosystem of strategic, game-changing partnerships are driving our transformation to a sustainable mobility tech company.


The driving force behind us is the diverse and talented group of men and women around the world who bring their passion and experience to their work every day. And while we are a truly global organization, we remain deeply rooted in the communities in which we operate and where our colleagues live and work.


With industrial operations in nearly 30 countries, Stellantis could consistently exceed the evolving needs and expectations of consumers in more than 130 markets, while creating superior value for all stakeholders.


Position Overview:

The Software Engineering Platforms Principal Engineer is a highly skilled expert responsible for leading the design, implementation, and optimization of DevOps platforms that enable efficient and scalable software development. This role focuses on providing best-in-class tools and frameworks for Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD), infrastructure-as-code (IaC), and cloud-based development pipelines. The Principal Engineer collaborates with internal stakeholders and engineering teams to ensure that DevOps platforms are robust, secure, and optimized for performance.


Key Responsibilities:

DevOps Platform Leadership:

  • Lead the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of DevOps platforms to enable high-performing development teams.
  • Architect scalable and secure CI/CD pipelines, ensuring consistency and reliability in software delivery.
  • Implement and manage infrastructure-as-code (IaC) frameworks, ensuring a repeatable, automated approach to infrastructure provisioning.

Collaboration & Stakeholder Management:

  • Collaborate with development, security, and infrastructure teams to align platform capabilities with business and technical requirements.
  • Act as a technical advisor to cross-functional teams, providing guidance on best practices for DevOps and platform engineering.

Platform Optimization and Automation:

  • Optimize platform performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency through continuous monitoring and improvement.
  • Lead automation efforts across software delivery pipelines, reducing manual intervention and increasing agility.
  • Implement tools and processes for effective configuration management and automated deployments.

Security, Compliance, and Reliability:

  • Ensure DevOps platforms adhere to security best practices and compliance requirements, including encryption, access controls, and auditing.
  • Drive strategies for disaster recovery, high availability, and platform resiliency.

Mentorship and Knowledge Sharing:

  • Mentor and coach engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and technical excellence.
  • Lead initiatives to upskill teams on platform capabilities and DevOps practices.


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Experience in DevOps platform engineering or software development.
  • Strong expertise in CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, TeamCity, or similar.
  • Deep understanding of infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure)
  • Proficiency with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Strong knowledge of cloud security, compliance frameworks, and best practices for platform security.
  • Experience with GitOps, continuous delivery, and deployment automation.
  • Familiarity with DevSecOps practices, integrating security into CI/CD workflows.



“At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, and disability. Diverse teams will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.”

title: Sr. Applications Engineer
description:
e-STORAGE is a subsidiary of Canadian Solar and a leading company specializing in the design, manufacturing, and integration of battery energy storage systems for utility-scale applications. The Company offers its own proprietary LFP battery solution, comprehensive EPC services, and innovative solutions aimed at improving grid operations, integrating clean energy, and contributing to a sustainable future. e-STORAGE has successfully implemented over 3.3 GWh DC of battery energy storage solutions in various locations, including the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and China. This significant accomplishment solidifies e-STORAGE's position as a key player in the global energy storage integration industry. Currently, the Company operates two fully automated, state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities with an annual production capacity of approaching 20 GWh. e-STORAGE is fully equipped to continue providing high-quality, scalable energy storage solutions and contribute to the widespread adoption of clean energy.

For additional information about e-STORAGE, visit


Canadian Solar was founded in 2001 in Canada and has been listed on NASDAQ since 2006. It is now one of the world's largest solar technology and renewable energy companies. Canadian Solar is a leading manufacturer of solar photovoltaic modules, provider of solar energy and battery storage solutions, and developer of utility-scale solar power and battery storage projects with a geographically diversified pipeline in various stages of development. Over the past 22 years, Canadian Solar has successfully delivered over 102 GW of premium-quality, solar photovoltaic modules to customers across the world. Likewise, since entering the project development business in 2010, Canadian Solar has developed, built, and connected over 9 GWp of solar power projects and over 3 GWh of battery storage projects across the world. Currently, the Company has approximately 700 MWp of solar power projects in operation, 8 GWp of projects under construction or in backlog (late-stage), and an additional 17 GWp of projects in advanced and early-stage pipeline. In addition, the Company has a total battery storage project development pipeline of 52 GWh, including approximately 2 GWh under construction or in backlog, and an additional 50 GWh at advanced and early-stage development. Canadian Solar is one of the most bankable companies in the solar and renewable energy industry.


Position Summary:

The Sr. Applications Engineer provides technical expertise to support Canadian Solar’s energy storage solutions. This position will be responsible for the pre-sales activities of utility-scale Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) including system sizing, preliminary design, and value engineering.

This role will require the chosen candidate to work closely with the commercial and engineering teams to help develop proposals for new storage project opportunities and provide technical support to respond to customer needs.


Responsibilities:

  • Understand customer’s needs from RFP or other documentation and determine project scope, schedule, technical specifications and risks.
  • Develop size models and conceptual drawings sets by working with other application engineers as needed.
  • Work with the procurement team to obtain quotes and prepare pricing for projects.
  • Prepare proposals including technical and commercial documentation in collaboration with other departments.
  • Negotiate technical and commercial contract terms with customers by working together with the commercial team.
  • Work closely with other business development and applications staff, engineering and procurement to ensure complete and shared project understanding and priorities.
  • Conduct technical and sales presentations and provide clarifications to customers and other departments.


Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in a pre-sale engineering role.
  • Direct experience in battery energy storage systems or utility-scale solar.
  • Exceptional technical aptitude including the ability to read and fully understand engineering schematics, technical advisory reports, and technology reviews.
  • Solid understanding of regulatory standards in Brazil related to energy storage and grid-interactive inverters.
  • Global perspective and awareness, and direct experience working across diverse cultures in a multinational company would be beneficial.
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering (preferably Electrical or Mechanical) is required;
    a graduate degree is strongly preferred.
  • Strong communication (written and verbal) skills in both Portuguese and English is required.

title: Senior Tax Manager
description:
Job Description

Tax Strategy and Planning

  • Develop and Implement Tax Strategy:
    Analyze the company’s operation, formulate comprehensive tax strategies an align tax plans with business objectives to optimize tax efficiency while minimizing tax risks.
  • Stay aware and plan for the tax reform:
     Continuously monitor the latest changes on tax reform and the overall tax environment in Brazil, evaluate the potential impact on the company’s tax position and proactively recommend adjustments from a tax perspective, as well as provide a plan on how to adopt to the new tax system. In addition, provide insights on the impact of latest tax legislation to our business on a regular basis.


Tax Compliance:

  • Oversee tax filings:
     Manage the preparation and timely submission of all taxes. Ensure the accuracy and completeness of tax filings in accordance with applicable tax laws and regulations.
  • Internal controls and tax governance:
     Establish and maintain robust internal controls over tax processes to ensure compliance with tax laws and company policies. Develop and implement tax governance frameworks to manage tax risks to an acceptable level. Build up tax system to support better internal control and operations.
  • Liaise with tax authority:
     Represent the company in communications with tax authorities. Respond to tax inquiries, audits, and disputes in a timely and professional manner. Negotiate with tax authorities to resolve issues favorably and minimize tax liabilities.


Team Leadership and Management

  • Lead and Manage Tax Team:
     Supervise a team of tax professionals, providing guidance, training, and performance evaluations. Assign tasks, set priorities, and ensure the efficient operation of the tax department.


Job Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Taxation, Accounting, Finance, Law or related field, professional certification (CPA, ACCA, or equivalent) is highly desirable.
  • Past experience in smartphone industry, consumer electronics industry or manufacturing industry is highly desirable.
  • Has at least 15 years of work experience in corporate tax, indirect taxes, transfer pricing, etc.
  • Proven experience as a tax director or senior manager or in a similar tax leadership role.
  • In-depth knowledge of tax laws and regulations for Brazil.
  • Excellent strategic and analytical thinking with detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy.
  • Experience in a multinational company.
  • Advanced English is required (daily contact with China).
  • Quick learning ability on company’s business model and new tax laws/practices.
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

title: Field Engineering Specialist
description:
Greenlane Renewables Inc., headquartered in metro Vancouver, Canada, is a pioneer in the rapidly growing renewable natural gas (“RNG”) industry. As a leading global provider of biogas upgrading systems, we are helping to clean up two of the largest and most difficult-to-decarbonize sectors of the global energy system:
the natural gas grid and the commercial transportation sector. Our systems produce clean, low-carbon and carbon-negative renewable natural gas (RNG) from organic waste sources including landfills, wastewater treatment plants, dairy farms, and food waste. Greenlane is the only biogas upgrading company offering the three main technologies:
waterwash, pressure swing adsorption, and membrane separation and has over 30 years industry experience, patented proprietary technology, over 100 hydrogen sulfide treatment systems sold, and over 135 biogas upgrading systems sold into 19 countries, including many of the largest RNG production facilities in the world. Greenlane is a publicly-traded company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX:
GRN).


This position will provide specialist on site Electrical and Instrumentation support to Field Commissioning and Service activities. Responsibilities will include the installation, commissioning, maintenance and service tasks on Greenlane equipment as per Greenlane Health, Safety and Quality Management systems. The role will involve working with Biogas upgrading products such as gas compressor systems, level and pressure controls, flow controls, gas chromatographs and gas analyzers.


Duties & Responsibilities:

Health and Safety/Quality

  • Demonstrate a personal commitment to Quality, Health, Safety and the Environment.
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement, and lead by example to ensure company goals are achieved and exceeded.
  • Participate in ongoing training and compliance requirements associated with the industry.
  • Supervise subcontractors on site this includes health, safety & quality compliance.
  • Adhere to the company's Health & Safety Policy and Quality Management System.
  • Perform risk assessments and prepare risk and method statements.
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement.


Installation and Commissioning

  • Coordinate and execute start-up and commissioning of Greenlane biogas upgrading plants including pretreatment, compression and upgrading systems.
  • Quality assurance on new equipment including testing new hardware and debugging new software including PLC program, HMI and industrial automation controls and equipment. i.E. VSDs, Soft Starters, Motors and Motor Controls and general electrical equipment.
  • Identify opportunities for product and process improvement.
  • Perform Factory Acceptance, Site Acceptance, and Performance Testing on new equipment and installations.
  • Identify, troubleshoot and resolve issues encountered during Commissioning.
  • Ability to design and/or develop new control systems and testing, maintaining and/or modifying existing systems
  • Provide on-the-job and classroom operation and maintenance training to customers.


Service and Maintenance

  • Provide on-site and remote specialist electrical, instrumentation and controls field service support for Biogas upgrading plants.
  • Troubleshooting Biogas process issues, low voltage electrical hardware and control system.
  • Analyze system data trend logs to diagnose issues and implement solutions on site and remotely.
  • Supervise site services and conduct lockout and re-start procedures.
  • Create troubleshooting reference documentation.
  • Interface with internal and external customers.
  • Generate detailed customer service reports and documentation.
  • Flexibility with working hours, as being part of an on call rotation and call out service is expected.
  • Be available for regular North American and on occasions, international travel.


Qualifications and Experience:

  • Engineering Degree or Trade Certification and experience with at least 5+ years of previous electrical instrumentation/controls industry experience.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and decision making capabilities.
  • A good understanding and ability to work with Siemens Automation Software and Hardware, Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) (S7-300, S7-1500) and HMI;
    e.G. Simatic Manager, TIA portal & WinCC.
  • Ability to read and understand the PLC control logic in programming environment i.E. Ladder logic, Function Blocks, Structure Text, SFC/Graph, and work with communication protocols Ethernet/IP, Profinet, Fieldbus, Modbus.
  • Experience using Hart communication devices is considered an asset.
  • Ability to read and understand the Low Voltage (up to 600V AC/ 50-60 HZ) Electrical diagrams and drawings.
  • Ability to read and understand Control system drawings and P&IDs.
  • Familiar and good understanding of Variable Speed Drives (VSDs), preferably ABB & WEG
  • Familiar with ATEX and working in explosive atmospheres.
  • Must be able to distinguish colors.
  • Valid driver's license, safe driving record.
  • Engineering experience within either CHP, Biogas, Anaerobic Digestion, Gas Engines, Diesel Engines, Generators, Power Generation, Waste to Energy, Landfill Gas would be an asset.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral with the ability to work with international colleagues.
  • Great attitude, personable, courteous and a great team player.
  • Ability to work under pressure and stay focused in a fast-paced environment.
  • Must be able to travel through South America up to 75% of the year
  • Understanding of Health, Safety and Environment legislation and requirements.


How to Apply:


We are an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from all qualified individuals. To be considered for this role please apply through the Greenlane Renewables page on LinkedIn and attach your resume. While we thank all interested candidates only those who are short-listed will be contacted.

title: Ad Operations Specialist
description:
Location:
Sao Palo, Brazil preferred;
remote USA or Amsterdam, NL or will be considered


About Whale TV

Whale TV is an independent TV operating system that makes TVs smart and simple to use. Since its inception in 2011, the company has worked with 400+ TV brands and enables 43M+ monthly active TVs around the world to help consumers discover, find and watch their favorite entertainment. With its easy-to-use TV OS, the company connects consumers, TV brands, content providers and advertisers. Whale TV is headquartered in Singapore and has teams collaborating across the globe to make TV better for everyone. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a mid-level Ad Operations Specialist to help manage and optimize our ad delivery and revenue performance.


Role Overview

As an Ad Operations Specialist , you will be responsible for the execution, monitoring, and optimization of digital ad campaigns across our CTV ecosystem. You will collaborate with internal teams, ad tech partners, and advertisers to ensure smooth campaign delivery, troubleshoot issues, and drive revenue growth.


Key Responsibilities

  1. Manage and optimize programmatic and direct-sold ad campaigns across Whale TV’s CTV inventory.
  2. Work closely with DSPs, SSPs, and ad exchanges to maximize fill rates and CPMs.
  3. Monitor campaign performance, troubleshoot delivery issues, and implement optimizations.
  4. Ensure compliance with industry standards (ads.Txt, app-ads.Txt, VAST, OpenRTB, etc.).
  5. Collaborate with sales, product, and engineering teams to enhance monetization strategies.
  6. Generate reports and insights for internal stakeholders and advertisers.


Qualifications

  1. 2–5 years of experience in digital ad operations, preferably in CTV or programmatic advertising.
  2. Strong understanding of ad serving, SSPs, DSPs, and programmatic buying.
  3. Familiarity with ad tech platforms such as SpringServe, FreeWheel, and Google Ad Manager.
  4. Proficiency in analyzing campaign performance metrics and troubleshooting delivery issues.
  5. Knowledge of ad formats, video ad standards (VAST, VMAP, OpenRTB), and brand safety tools.
  6. Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
  7. Spoken and written fluency in English, Chinese and Spanish or Portguese.


Why Join Whale TV?

Work at the forefront of the CTV revolution.

Collaborate with top ad tech partners and innovative brands.

Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for career growth.

title: Business Development Manager – Brazil
description:
About Streamax :

Streamax is a leading global provider of fleet management and transportation solutions, dedicated to improving the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of transportation operations. As part of our global expansion, we are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Business Development Manager (BDM) to drive our growth in Brazil.

Role Overview :

As the Business Development Manager for Brazil, you will be responsible for identifying and capitalizing on new business opportunities, building strong relationships with potential and existing clients, and executing growth strategies in line with Streamax’s mission and values. This role requires a deep understanding of the transportation and fleet management industry, excellent market knowledge, and a strong ability to navigate business negotiations within the Brazilian market.

Key Responsibilities :

Market Expansion & Opportunity Identification :

Identify new business opportunities in the Brazilian transportation sector, focusing on fleet management, telematics, and related solutions.

Conduct market research to understand industry trends, customer needs, and competitive dynamics in the region.

Develop and implement targeted strategies to penetrate new markets and segments.

Client Relationship Management :

Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key clients, stakeholders, and industry influencers.

Act as a trusted advisor to clients, providing tailored solutions to meet their fleet management needs.

Manage the sales pipeline from lead generation to contract negotiation and closing.

Sales Strategy & Execution :

Collaborate with the Regional Sales Director to develop and execute business development strategies and sales plans specific to Brazil.

Meet and exceed sales targets and KPIs through effective sales techniques, presentations, and negotiations.

Track sales performance, provide forecasts, and adjust strategies to meet market demands.

Partnerships & Collaboration :

Establish and maintain partnerships with local distributors, integrators, and other industry players to enhance market penetration.

Work closely with internal teams, including marketing, product, and technical support, to ensure seamless execution of client projects and delivery.

Brand Promotion & Industry Engagement :

Promote Streamax’s brand and solutions at industry events, trade shows, and conferences in Brazil.

Act as the primary ambassador for Streamax in the region, raising awareness of our offerings and enhancing the company’s reputation in the market.

Reporting & Analysis :

Provide regular updates and reports on market trends, sales performance, competitor activity, and opportunities to the Regional Sales Director.

Analyze sales data and customer feedback to refine strategies and improve sales performance.

Qualifications :

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or related field (Master’s degree preferred).

5+ years of experience in business development or sales, with a proven track record in the fleet management, telematics, or transportation solutions industry.

Strong understanding of the Brazilian market, including business practices, regulations, and industry trends.

Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with fluency in Portuguese and English.

Self-driven, results-oriented, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.

Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required.

title: Data Information Architect
description:
Description

Capgemini is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Information Architect for a top 10 US Insurance Carrier.

This role is for a skilled Data Information Architect to design and implement data solutions supporting Servicing Ops Analytics, Reporting and AI. They are responsible for the definition, creation and maintenance of architecture artifacts for data solutions along with definition of Data Architecture processes across Data & Analytics in Service Ops. The Information Architect is expected to understand current and future architecture, reporting and warehousing technologies to effectively architect future target state solutions for Service Ops data and analytics.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Snowflake, Python, Azure and AWS, along with a strong foundation Big Data, and Cloud Platforms. You will be responsible for developing scalable, efficient data architectures that enable personalized customer experiences, BI, and advanced analytics.


  • Work towards a data strategy that maximizes the value of data as an asset, along with a migration strategy from our current state to our future state architecture.
  • Responsible for definition, creation and maintenance of architecture artifacts of data solutions including data architecture, data flow diagrams, conceptual/logical data models, data dictionaries, and database design.
  • Design and optimize data pipelines that integrate various data sources (1st party, 3rd party, operational) to support business intelligence and advanced analytics.
  • Develop data models and data flows that enable personalized customer experiences and support omnichannel marketing and customer engagement.
  • Implement and maintain data warehousing solutions in Snowflake to handle large-scale data processing and analytics needs.
  • Support both real-time and batch data integration, ensuring data is accessible for actionable insights and decision-making.

Our Client is one of the United States’ largest insurers, providing a wide range of insurance and financial services products with gross written premium well over US$25 Billion (P&C). They proudly serve more than 10 million U.S. households with more than 19 million individual policies across all 50 states through the efforts of over 48,000 exclusive and independent agents and nearly 18,500 employees. Finally, our Client is part of one the largest Insurance Groups in the world.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience in Data Architecture or Data Engineering, with expertise in technologies such as AWS, Snowflake, and Azure.
  • Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL/ELT processes, and modern data architecture frameworks.
  • Minimun 2 years - experience designing scalable data architectures for customer analytics and operations.
  • Expertise with cloud data platforms (AWS preferred) and Big Data technologies for large-scale data processing.
  • Hands-on experience with Python for data engineering tasks and scripting.
  • Proven track record of building and managing data pipelines and data warehousing solutions such as Snowflake, AWS.
  • Familiarity with Customer Data Platforms (CDP), Master Data Management (MDM), and Customer 360 architectures.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable data solutions.
  • Proficient knowledge in modern data architecture that supports advanced analytics including Snowflake, Azure, etc.
  • Self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products.
  • Expert knowledge of data modeling, documentation and governance tools and techniques.
  • English Proficiency:
    Fluent


Other Critical Skills

Experience in Data Architecture or Data Engineering, with expertise in technologies such as AWS, Snowflake, and Azure.

- Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL/ELT processes, and modern data architecture frameworks.
- Advanced

- Expertise with cloud data platforms (AWS preferred) and Big Data technologies for large-scale data processing.

title: Account Representative
description:
Job Description

Smith & Associates is looking for an Account Representative to join our Brazil team. Once you join this team, you will become acquainted with our core values that define Smith. With a reputation of nearly 40 years of excellence, Smith & Associates is leading the way in electronic component distribution. Our diverse portfolio of pieces can be found in automotive, industrial, computing, networking, telecom, consumer electronics, medical devices, solar, and aerospace and defense. Our 19 offices range from Silicon Valley, New York City, Munich, Shenzhen and Shanghai, with hubs in Houston, Amsterdam, Hong Kong and Singapore.


Position Summary

Develop business through networking and sales calls to sell semiconductors, electronic components equipment and other Smith’s products and services globally.

  • Conduct diligent research for customer leads using the internet and additional tools.
  • Heavy cold calling and prospecting of customers in an effort advertise and upsell the value-added services that Smith has to offer.
  • Negotiate prices with customers according to market trends.
  • Interface with the purchasing team to stay informed of current inventory.
  • Maintain relationships with customers to retain sales and cultivate a continuous pipeline of prospects.
  • Develop specific marketing strategies to generate sales leads, pursue industry growth and discover the best way to represent Smith to established clients.


Required Skills

  • Must have experience selling semiconductors
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience
  • Cold calling and relationship building experience required
  • Aptitude to connect with customers over the phone and face to face in order to build relationships and close deals
  • Willingness to make outbound phone calls every day
  • Committed to customer satisfaction, confidentiality and ability manage proprietary data
  • Very dynamic and self-motivated


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Sales Director
description:
Sales Director


Doo Prime is a Multinational Corporation and international pre-eminent Multi-Asset online broker & Trading Platform, which strives to provide professional investors with global Forex (FX) and CFD trading products, with operations centers in Dallas, Sydney, Singapore, Hong Kong, Dubai.


Looking for a New Challenge? Join Us as We Expand Globally!

As we continue our global business expansion, we’re on the lookout for talented individuals who are motivated to support our strategic goals and initiatives. Join a team that values innovation and growth.


We welcome sales professionals at all levels including Business Development Manager, Team Lead, Sales Manager, Country Manager, Head of Sales, etc.


What you’ll be working on:

  • Drive market expansion by proactively identifying and capitalizing on new business opportunities, with a focus on opening and developing new markets.
  • Build and nurture a sales team capable of achieving outstanding results, fostering a high-performance culture, and aligning strategies with overall company objectives.
  • Act as key advisor to the company on market, analyse sales data for insights, and adapt strategies to meet evolving customer needs.
  • Collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional teams and the marketing department to ensure aligned and effective market penetration strategies.
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including partners and clients, to enhance the company's reputation and facilitate business development.
  • Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies to senior management, offering insights into market dynamics, competitive landscapes, and opportunities for growth.
  • Utilize CRM systems effectively for comprehensive data management and strategic decision-making.
  • Oversee the recruitment, onboarding, and professional development of sales team members, demonstrating a commitment to excellence in team performance.
  • Travel as necessary to meet with partners, clients, and explore regional market opportunities, contributing to the company's broader expansion initiatives.


Who are we looking for?

  • Strong sales and negotiation skills, with a track record of successfully closing deals and building long-term client relationships.
  • Self-motivated and results-driven, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Deep knowledge and experience of the LATAM/MENA/APAC markets is a bonus.
  • Strong understanding of financial markets, investment products, and trading strategies.
  • Capacity to provide insightful suggestions to both the management and the marketing team on how to navigate and grow in the financial markets.
  • Strong leadership and team management skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
  • Strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to analyze sales data and trends to drive decision-making.
  • Proficiency in CRM software and sales analytics tools.
  • Negotiation skills and the ability to close complex deals.

title: Industry Solutions Internship, Performance Management
description:
Who is o9?

Smart. Simple. Fun. All words to describe our environment at o9 Solutions. An exciting and

high energy environment that drives us to grow and AIM 10x. The perfect place to be innovative,

collaborative and dynamic as an organization, and work for a truly global organization. We’re always looking for great talent to join our o9 team.


Company Overview

Our Integrated Demand Management (IDM) solutions are not just helping organizations forecast demand better. They are helping sense, analyze, plan, and shape it to optimize sales and margin performance. Our Integrated Business Planning (IBP) solutions are helping organizations move from executive dash- boarding to a collaborative, analytic insights driven platform for alignment of cross-functional plans, initiatives, and resources to changing market needs. Our Integrated Supply Management (ISM) solutions are powering digital supply chain capabilities that make complex supply chains dramatically more responsive, cost effective and reliable in meeting market needs.


Our headquarters are located in Dallas, with offices in Amsterdam, Paris, London, Barcelona, Madrid, Milan, Munich, Bangalore, Tokyo, Seoul, Toronto and Sao Paulo.


The o9 Internship program is designed to give students real-world, applicable, professional experience by working on revenue impacting projects and being involved in our day-to-day operations, as well as by being exposed to o9’s leadership.


What you’ll do…

  • Support the industry solutions team to drive differentiated messaging and value propositions for implementing Supply Chain and Integrated Business Planning solutions.
  • Work with o9 sales teams to support strategic goals definitions and route to market strategy and translate into integrated programs supporting industry growth.
  • Support Industry Segmentation (Whales, Elephants, Others) analyses and execution of pursuit models for segments.
  • Participate (and help organize) industry trade shows, webinars, round tables to spread o9 brand in target industry.
  • Co-create and adapt thought leadership content to be used in marketing campaigns and to support on-going client discussions.
  • Use our sales management platform to analyze the pipeline, TAM coverage, and other KPIs, generating insights for the team.
  • Structure dashboards that provide intelligent analyses, enabling us to manage our customers globally.
  • Support Sales & Marketing team meetings, suggesting improvements in structure and organization when necessary.


What you’ll have…

  • Works effectively in a matrix environment with teams of high-level professionals.
  • Passionate about creative ideas and bringing customer-centric innovation for superior customer
  • experience and higher impact.
  • Have effective communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
  • Drive and curiosity to learn about new topics.
  • Ability to work comfortably in a team environment with changing priorities and time pressures, and sometimes across time zones as needed.
  • Experience in Excel, PowerPoint and building KPIs and dashboard desired
  • Interested in learning more about cutting-edge topics in Supply Chain and Technology, like Digital Twins and AI/ML.
  • Any industry experience in a planning function within supply chain planning and/or Sales and
  • Operations planning (S&OP) is a plus.


Program overview

  • Competitive pay for up to 30 hours a week, Monday through Friday.
  • Content sessions including leadership roundtables.


o9 is an equal opportunity employer and seeks applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation

or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Sap Functional Tax Specialist
description:
We are seeking an experienced SAP Functional Lead – Tax (Brazil) to drive the tax workstream in an ERP transformation project. This role will be responsible for assessing the effort required to upgrade from the current Oracle ERP to an existing SAP S/4HANA global template and will be responsible for confirming functional tax requirements are being addressed during the implementation phase.

This position requires a deep understanding of Brazilian tax regulations and expertise in SAP S/4HANA tax localization. The ideal candidate will ensure compliance with Brazilian tax laws while maintaining alignment with global finance and tax processes. Fluency in Portuguese and English (spoken and written) is required for this role.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze the current Oracle ERP tax setup and define the scope, effort, and impact of transitioning to an existing SAP S/4HANA global template.
  • Conduct a fit-gap analysis to compare Brazil’s tax requirements with the global template, identifying localization needs.
  • Provide recommendations on tax process optimizations in SAP S/4HANA while ensuring compliance with Brazilian regulations.
  • Define the data migration strategy for tax-related master and transactional data.
  • Collaborate with global and local stakeholders to finalize the tax migration roadmap.
  • Serve as the Brazil Functional Tax Lead during the SAP S/4HANA implementation.
  • Lead the configuration and deployment of SAP tax settings, including SAP TDF (Tax Declaration Framework), SAP ACR (Advanced Compliance Reporting), and SAP Nota Fiscal.
  • Ensure compliance with applicable Brazilian fiscal regulations, including ICMS, IPI, PIS, COFINS, ISS, withholding taxes, SPED reporting, and e-invoicing (Nota Fiscal Eletronica - NF-e).
  • Work closely with global teams to adapt the SAP S/4HANA global template while ensuring Brazilian localization requirements are met.
  • Oversee data migration, integration testing, and UAT for tax processes.
  • Act as the primary liaison between tax, finance, IT, and SAP functional teams to ensure smooth implementation.
  • Provide training and knowledge transfer to local tax and finance teams.
  • Support post-go-live stabilization and continuous process improvements.

Required Qualifications

  • Fluent in English and Portuguese (spoken and written).
  • 10+ years of experience in SAP tax configuration with a strong focus on Brazilian tax localization.
  • Proven experience leading tax workstreams in SAP S/4HANA global template implementations.
  • Hands-on expertise with SAP S/4HANA, including TDF, ACR, and Nota Fiscal solutions.
  • Experience conducting fit-gap analysis and defining localization requirements within a global template.
  • Strong knowledge of Oracle ERP tax modules and prior experience in Oracle-to-SAP migrations.
  • Deep understanding of Brazilian tax regulations, compliance reporting, and electronic invoicing.
  • Excellent leadership, stakeholder management, and critical thinking skills.
  • Experience working in a global, multi-entity environment is preferred.


About Donyati

Donyati was founded as a challenge to the status quo of business and technology consulting. At Donyati we leverage technology to solve business challenges and deliver innovative solutions with expertise, hard work and passion. We listen, advise, and deliver on a continuous basis to achieve our client’s desired outcomes. We always have our client’s best interests at heart.

To learn more, please visit us @

title: Sr. Football Trader
description:
We’re Entain. Our vision is to be the world leader in sports betting and gaming entertainment by creating the most exciting and trusted experience for our customers, revolutionizing the gambling space as we go.


We're home to a global family of more than 25 well-known brands, and with a focus on sustainability and growth, we will transform our sector for our players, for ourselves and for the good of entertainment.


Senior Football Trader

Summary of role;
To support and maximisethe growth and profitability of Entain’s South American labels, by leading on the effective day to day trading and management of positions and liabilities underpinned by local knowledge. Prioritisation of work within the South American Trading team, mentoring and developing Traders. The role has a critical impact on Entain Trading results.

Combining both global and local betting/football knowledge Senior Trader will be a point of contact for the wider business/Trading managers whilst maintaining the Football product in accordance with risk guidelines and group strategy.


Key Responsibilities:

● Work closely with Group Trading and Commercial team to understand and bring to life daily and long-term strategy.

● Delivery of product, specifically the production and trading of prices for S. American events.

● Point of contact for the wider business when on shift, always conversing professionally in person and via email/teams.

● Prioritise work and areas of focus for Traders on shift.

● Take ownership of issues as they arise and escalate accordingly.

● Monitor Pre-Match & In-Play betting on key LATAM football leagues, controlling liabilities and always adhering with compliance and regulatory guidelines.

● Trade key events using automated odds models and manage market risk in accordance with liability management protocols and market conditions

● Create specials and boosted bets (Pre and Live) in alignment with commercial team.

● Supplement automation by trading manual In-Play markets on key events.

● Monitor local and global betting markets and customer betting activity in real time.

● Identify translation and content issues across the S. American product.

●Track expected line-ups and fixture news on social media to ensure a relevant offer and generate unique markets for the S. American customer base.

● Ensure the Entain Football product is maintained in line with strategy

● Identify betting trends supported by statistical data and pass information to Senior members of the team / management.

● Maintain internal relationships with Marketing, PR and the Content teams to maximize publicity opportunities and engagement with the media and social media.

● Monitor and identify customer behaviour annotating where appropriate and liaise with Sportsbook, profiling, responsible gambling and compliance teams in line with trading strategy.

● Resolve technical and operational incidents in real time and escalate where appropriate.

● Ensure flexibility within the role - remain adaptable to pricing, trading and market driver awareness.


Key Accountabilities:

● Ensure accuracy of pricing and event management in line with group strategy.

● Develop and maintain key relationships with other Traders, Senior Traders, Operational managers and Heads of Trading functions.

● Adhere to risk management guidelines.

● Identify and/or report technical deficiencies to Operational Manager / Head of Football.

● Communicate any issues encountered in-real time to management and Trading Support.

● Ensure active and effective communication with internal Marketing, PR and Retail teams for maximum exposure of Entain prices.

● Identify improvements to trading applications and capabilities.

● Implement new ideas around all product markets and technology to improve performance, profitability, competitive advantage and customer experience

● Monitor down-streams ensuring optimal product presentation, escalating where required.


Qualifications and Educational Requirements:

● GCSE Maths at grade A or equivalent


Specialist Skills and Experience Required:

● In depth knowledge of South American football.

● 5+ years trading experience.

● Ability to adapt skill set to ensure success of top line strategy.

● Use of algorithm-based trading applications.

● Demonstrate understanding of key time awareness, league code profiles, compiling, market drivers and Asian awareness.

● Highly numerate with a solid grasp on numbers, odds and their significance.

● Analytical or statistical background.

● Ability to overcome technological difficulties calmly whilst demonstrating a positive outcome mentality.

● Flexibility around working times (including unsociable hours/weekends)

● Strong time keeping.

● High attention to detail.

● Strong communications skills.

● Team player that encourages and supports all other members of the team.

● Critical thinker.


Additional Information:

● Full training on Entain systems to be provided.


Diversity and equal opportunities


As a global employer, Entain is committed to providing a safe, fun, and inclusive culture where our people feel like they truly belong.


We are a multicultural business that values, celebrates and respects individual differences, so whatever your sexuality, gender, gender identity, ability, age, race, religion or belief, you will have a voice here, and the space to do your best work.


Our diverse internal networks provide the support for you to express your views and make a positive difference, all for the good of entertainment.


#LI-Hybrid

title: Production Engineer
description:
Production Engineer - High-Tech Industry (English Speakers)

Location:
The Netherlands (on-site), 2 year contract with potential of permanent employment, NOT project/freelance


About the Company:

We are at the forefront of high-tech manufacturing, specializing in cutting-edge production systems. We work on pioneering technologies that have a global impact. Join our team to make a significant contribution to the future of manufacturing. We’re looking for Production Engineers who are excited to solve complex, technical challenges and be part of an innovative team pushing the limits of what’s possible.


Role and Responsibilities:


As a First Line Support Competence Engineer , you’ll take a lead role in solving technical challenges within pilot and volume production. You will work closely with engineering teams to minimize downtime and ensure the highest quality of production for our customers. This is not just a troubleshooting role — you’ll be a key problem-solver and leader in driving solutions.

Your daily responsibilities will include:

. Leading troubleshooting of complex technical issues in production systems at our Veldhoven site. You’ll be the go-to expert for resolving difficult problems, with a target solving power of 95%.

. Providing technical support for rapid resolution of issues, ensuring minimal impact on cycle time.

. Preventing recurring problems by collaborating with Manufacturing Engineering and Design Engineering teams to feed back issue resolutions.

. Empowering the 1st line engineers by sharing knowledge and contributing to a culture of self-sufficiency.

. Taking the lead in continuous improvement initiatives to optimize production processes.


What We’re Looking For:


We seek recent graduates or engineers with 1-3 years of experience who are eager to develop their skills in a high-tech manufacturing environment. If you have a passion for complex systems, problem-solving, and continuous learning, this is the perfect opportunity to kickstart your career.


Essential Requirements:


  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s in a technical field such as Mechanical Engineering, Electronics, Mechatronics, or Applied Physics.
  • Previous experience in a production environment with complex high-tech products, preferably in troubleshooting and solving technical issues.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a solid foundation in engineering.
  • Fluency in English is essential.
  • A curious, proactive mindset with a desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment


Skills & Qualities You’ll Need to Succeed:


  • Strong team player mentality with flexibility to adapt to new challenges.
  • Excellent communication skills — you can explain complex technical concepts to diverse teams.
  • A pragmatic attitude and plenty of initiative, always looking for ways to improve processes.
  • High sense of responsibility and ability to stay calm and focused under pressure.
  • Organizational skills and ability to balance multiple tasks effectively.


What You’ll Love About This Job:


  • Innovative Work Environment:
     You’ll be part of a team working at the cutting edge of technology, solving unique challenges every day.
  • Collaborative Culture:
     You won’t be working in isolation. You’ll collaborate with a diverse team of experts and have the space to contribute your unique perspective.
  • Career Growth:
     With plenty of opportunities for continuous learning and career progression, you’ll have the chance to grow in the high-tech industry.
  • Flexible Working Conditions:
     Enjoy a modern, flexible work environment with activity-based working, allowing you to thrive in a dynamic office space.


Context of the position:


· The EUV factory is responsible for both production and installation of NXE and EXE systems. Most technical issues (80%) are solved by the work-centers (self-reliance). 20% is too difficult to solve by generalists and is escalated to specialists:
the first line support engineers. First line support has 10 competences and a solving power of ~95%. First line support consists of engineering groups with a group lead each.

· The first line support engineer reports to the first line support group lead, which reports to the first line support manager.

· Works in shifts:
mild shift schedule containing 10 dayshifts, 5 evening, 1 weekend in 4 weeks (no night). Call-out support during public holidays.

· Willing to travel in case of urgent escalation at customer site (not frequent).

· Mobile phone, laptop;
we are working in an Activity Based Working office (flex-desks).


If any of the below competencies match your experience, then you are who we are looking for!


. Programming Languages:
 Python , C++ , and MATLAB for developing, testing, and optimizing systems.

. Automation & Control Systems:
 Experience with LabVIEW or other automation and control system programming tools.

. Technical Problem Solving:
 Strong ability to troubleshoot complex mechanical, electrical, and software-related issues in high-tech production environments.

. Project Management:
 Proven experience managing engineering projects, from planning to execution, including coordinating teams and resources.

. Data Analysis & Optimization:
 Solid skills in data analysis and process optimization using software tools like Excel , Simulink , or Tableau .

. Embedded Systems:
 Experience with embedded systems programming or hardware/software integration.

. Mechanical/Electrical Design Tools:
 Proficiency with CAD tools (e.G., SolidWorks, AutoCAD) or electrical circuit design software (e.G., Altium, Eagle).

. Testing & Calibration:
 Hands-on experience with testing, calibration, and validation of complex systems and machinery.

. System Integration:
 Knowledge of integrating various high-tech systems for seamless performance in production.


Who is Xelvin?

Xelvin is a Dutch consultancy company specializing in Engineering and Technical Trades. We hire Artisans, National Degree, Bachelor, Masters and PHD candidates with a background in Mechatronics, Electronics, Electrical, Mechanical, Automotive and Physics. Our focus is within the High-Tech and Manufacturing industry in Eindhoven region.

Xelvin is specialized in International Recruitment, within Europe and beyond. In the past years we have helped over a thousand candidates from more than 50 different nationalities with finding their perfect job here in the Netherlands and are striving to help so many more!

As Xelvin we hire candidates for a specific position for a set amount of time, after which a permanent contract with our client is granted and the candidates automatically transfers.


What do we offer?

Contract wise:

· 1-year contract of 40 hours per week (with potential of long-term employment).

· 25 paid holidays a year (+ potential ADV days)

· Public holidays, with a maximum of 7 per year, which are paid by Xelvin.

· Holiday allowance of 8.33% (instead of 8,0%) over your total gross annual income. Paid each year in May.

· Overtime and shift allowance will be paid by Xelvin accordingly.

· Travel allowance of €0,23 per km, for the use of travelling to work and back home.

· The salary will range from €3600 to €4600 gross (plus shift allowance if applicable)


Onboarding & benefits:

· Finding your 1st accommodation in the Netherlands will be supported by Xelvin, with the help of our Housing Consultant (we help you find accommodation). In case of having to pay the 1st months rent or potential deposit, Xelvin is willing to pay it for you upfront, after which we’ll set up a loan agreement, for you to pay us back in terms.

· Xelvin is certified to do VISA applications for you and your family and get your work permit in order so you can travel and start working (if required).

· A relocation assistance allowance of €1000 - €1500 NET will be paid to you, to assist with the cost of relocating to the Netherlands.

· You (and your family/partner) will be picked up at the airport or train station by your consultant/ recruiter after your arrival and will be taken to your new house.

· Onboarding:
we’ll advise you on how to set up a Dutch bank account, apply for health insurance, getting a Dutch BSN number, writing in with a dentist and general practitioner and other useful or necessary cases to arrange.

· New Hire Dinner organized for all newly recruited engineers to make them aware of our Dutch tax system and explaining the Dutch payslip.

· A few social gatherings with all Xelvin employees and recruited engineers;

. New Years drinkat the local PSV stadium, where you’ll get a tour of the building and beverages and bites are served.

. Summer BBQ at the Evoluon, where you can grow your social circle and dance to some nice music while enjoying the food.

title: Compensation Advisor (North America)
description:
We are seeking an experienced Total Rewards professional to deliver compensation solutions to our North America geography. Sitting within the global Total Rewards function in HR, this role will work with multiple groups within and outside of HR, including Talent Advisors, Executive Compensation, HR Services, and Finance, and encompasses a mix of project work and “business as usual” activities.

The Role

  • Support the aligned Compensation Lead in the design and implementation of broad-based compensation initiatives and project work streams, ensuring effective solutions.
  • Develop compensation solutions, including retention proposals, senior offer proposals, incentive plan designs
  • Advise client groups on broad-based compensation issues and processes, in line with WTW’s compensation philosophy.
  • Support the delivery of the annual compensation review process end-to-end process, including partnering with the assigned client group and/or delivering on compensation operations workstreams.
  • Manage processes related to compensation changes throughout the year (mid-year, off-cycle), working with assigned client groups, providing advice to ensure an effective process.
  • Manage benchmarking requests with the support of the analyst team.
  • Execute compensation analysis and outline key findings in compelling proposals to facilitate decision-making
  • Lead or contribute to compensation projects, from planning/design to successful execution.
  • Work with stakeholders and client groups to understand specific local compensation-related issues and develop effective solutions.
  • Provide compensation expertise and training to assigned clients group to ensure all compensation related activities are understood and delivered effectively.


The Requirements

  • Experience in a Compensation Advisor/Manager role, including delivering annual compensation review, benchmarking, and development of compensation proposals and analysis
  • Continuous improvement mindset and ability to identify opportunities for improvement
  • Experience leading or contributing effectively to projects within Total Rewards environments
  • Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills
  • Exceptional client relationship skills;
    ability to develop strong relationships quickly and maximize resources effectively to achieve goals
  • Strong organizational abilities and flexibility to work in a performance-driven environment managing multiple deliverables
  • Understanding of the compensation market, trends, regulations, and economic environment impacting it
  • Advanced English


Desirable:

  • Experience working remotely in a global organisation
  • PowerBI skills or advanced reporting/analytics skills
  • Degree or equivalent in human resources, business or related field preferred


Remote work


Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Customer Support Agent
description:
We are SkillOnNet, we are leading the igaming entertainment by providing our customers with the most entertaining and trustworthy experience possible, while also reinventing the gambling industry. We are home to more than 30 well-known brands, including PlayOJO, DruckGluck, BacanaPlay, Genting, and many more. We are committed to long-term development and sustainability, and we are trying to revolutionise our industry for the benefit of our players, ourselves, and the entertainment industry as a whole.


Job Description

As a Customer Support Agent, you will interact with customers and assist them with their inquiries. You would be representing the company, thus you must possess a vibrant and responsible character, as well as the capacity to work in shifts.


Your Responsibilities

  • Communicate effectively with customers in their preferred language.
  • Maintain high-quality standards with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Deliver exceptional customer experiences, resolving issues during the first contact.
  • Clarify and resolve product or service concerns by identifying issues, explaining solutions, and ensuring follow-ups for resolution.
  • Respond professionally to inquiries via Webchat, Email, and Phone.
  • Escalate customer requests when necessary and ensure timely follow-up.
  • Investigate customer concerns thoroughly to provide satisfactory outcomes.
  • Champion and promote a “Safer Gaming” philosophy.
  • Stay informed about current rules, processes, and licensing requirements.
  • Collaborate with team members to achieve shared goals.
  • Go above and beyond to create meaningful customer interactions.
  • Participate actively in onboarding programs to enhance your skills and knowledge.


What We’re Looking For

  • Fluency in English and native proficiency in Portuguese. Additional languages are a plus.
  • Prior customer service experience is welcomed but not essential, as we provide comprehensive in-house training.
  • Strong communication and active listening skills, with the ability to connect with diverse individuals.
  • Customer-focused with adaptability to handle various personality types.
  • Competence in using computers, including proficiency in touch typing.
  • Resilience to perform well under pressure.
  • A responsible, conscientious, and accountable approach to work.
  • Flexibility to work shifts when required.


What’s in It for You?

  • A welcoming and inclusive work environment.
  • Competitive salary package.
  • Monetary vouchers for birthdays and other special occasions.
  • Engaging company activities, such as monthly lunches, team gatherings, competitions, and more.
  • Opportunities for professional growth within one of the world’s leading iGaming organizations.


What It’s Like to Work at SkillOnNet

At SkillOnNet, people come first. Our global culture is grounded in a “family-oriented” ethos where every individual feels valued and supported. We prioritize providing employees with access to relevant tools, benefits, and opportunities to thrive professionally and personally.

Join us and become part of a team that’s making a difference in the world of iGaming!

description:
