title: Field Service Specialist
description:
The Position:

The Field Service Specialist - Solar plays an important role with this rapid growing company. This is a very dynamic and fast-track position reporting to the Field Service Manager. The position will be the key member of service team. This position will also be the technical point of the contact person support commercial, industrial and utility-scale solar.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform as a lead on more complex field engineering assignments
  • Perform pre-commissioning (with and without grid emulator) and commissioning of solar inverters achieving the milestones agreed with utility scale customers
  • Perform and/or lead Preventive Maintenance and O&M activities as needed
  • Perform a variety of engineering assignment involving technology applications involved in the installation, operation, testing and maintenance of central and string solar inverter
  • Perform electrical and electronic troubleshooting and testing of solar inverters and its components in the field or in the laboratory. Use of PQA and oscilloscope is required as needed
  • Perform and/or troubleshooting in your region assigned to investigate solar plant issues such as DC arrays grid faults, inverter design issues, and utility grid transients
  • Provide feedback to the engineering team on possible mechanical and electrical design improvements
  • Lead upgrade projects (software and hardware) in the field and interact with customers to explain the technical scope of the project
  • Work with customer SCADA engineers to set-up systems communication and parameters
  • Create Field Service procedures if there is not available for trouble-shooting, and maintenance
  • Participate on training material some customers as requested but the Training Manager
  • Research alternative components that can be used in the field
  • Coordinate with R&D engineering in China if required help during troubleshooting
  • Take the lead in some projects such as upgrades or retrofit as well as commissioning
  • Independently performs a range of field service tasks involving communication with Factory Engineering

and Customer’s solar plant engineer

  • Coordinate and work closely with other engineering, logistic, financial, and program management disciplines to maintain the solar plants
  • Help on the repair activities in the Service center
  • Prepare, deliver and submit field reports to customer and management
  • Support development of technical proposal and provide comments on the technical content and level of effort of the proposed scope of work
  • Conduct site visits, experimental investigations and analyze engineering problems, propose solutions and alterative, and provide recommendations


Minimum Requirements:

  • Previous experience in Field Service
  • Previous experience in solar inverters
  • Must possess the ability to work with test equipment and hand tools as required
  • Must possess customer service, problem-solving skills, and possess decision making and analytical skills
  • Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to closely follow instruction and pre-established procedures/SOP to perform the ductions of the job
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, power Point and Outlook)
  • Electrical Safety


Education or Desired License and Certificates:

  • Bachelor’s degree or Technical degree with equivalent experience
  • Solar industry experience is required


Competencies

  • Technical problem solving/analytical skills
  • Self-starter, strong initiatives and an excellent communicator
  • System and product level mindset
  • Organization, detailed-oriented nature and strong initiative
  • Strong technical support focus and a service-oriented individual both with Sales team and customers


Work Location and Status:

  • São Paulo State or Montes Claros (MG)
  • Office in Osasco, SP
  • Availability to national and international travels (70-80%)

title: Data Analyst
description:
Onebridge is a Consulting firm with an HQ in Indianapolis, and clients dispersed throughout the United States and beyond. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly skilled Data Analyst to join an innovative and dynamic group of professionals at a company rated among the top “Best Places to Work” in Indianapolis since 2015.


Employment Type:
Full Time

Location:
Remote - Brazil

Industry:
IT & Services, Data & Analytics, Healthcare.


Data Analyst | About You

As a Data Analyst, you focus on analyzing and interpreting data to provide insights that drive business decisions and improve system performance. You gather requirements from both internal teams and clients, identify data trends, and offer actionable recommendations. You are passionate about using data to solve business challenges, whether it’s identifying trends, troubleshooting data issues, or supporting decision-making processes. You bring strong analytical skills and attention to detail, ensuring data integrity and clarity in your reports.


Data Analyst | Day-to-Day

  • Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, anomalies, and insights that impact business processes and system performance.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, working closely with clients and internal teams to ensure data accuracy.
  • Manage and resolve ServiceNow tickets related to data issues, ensuring timely resolution.
  • Gather data requirements from stakeholders, documenting them to ensure accurate reporting and analysis.
  • Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis, supporting better business decisions.


Data Analyst | Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, with expertise in data analysis and problem-solving.
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
  • Familiarity with ERP systems, ensuring smooth data flows between systems and business processes.
  • Fluent in English, with excellent communication skills to work with international clients and technical teams.
  • Experience with Tableau for creating reports and visualizations is a bonus.



A Best Place to Work in Indiana since 2015

title: Technical Sales Executive - Data Protection
description:
NOTE:
ONLY ENGLISH LANGUAGE RESUMES will be considered. Please submit your resume as a pdf in English for consideration.


Bocada is seeking a dynamic and results-driven Technical Sales Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background and a proven track record nurturing, closing and supporting customers of SaaS or enterprise software solutions. This role involves engaging with potential customers, providing technical expertise to demonstrate the product and value and facilitating customer activation and onboarding processes for Bocada prospects and customers. Our technical sales executives are educators, hands-on problem solvers and great communicators.

This is an opportunity to join a small team and grow with it as the company expands its sales and marketing efforts for both established and new products. The Technical Sales Executive will execute sales tactics to convert leads to paying customers including engaging marketing-generated leads with email and phone calls to schedule initial meetings and follow up with customers to make them paying customers. Bocada is a small company looking for entrepreneurial and versatile team members willing to roll up their sleeves to win customers. This role is compensated with a base salary + commissions on converted sales.

Technical Sales Executive Responsibilities

  • Engage leads who register for the Bocada Cloud SaaS product to answer questions and drive the registered lead to a demo or activation meeting
  • Attend Bocada Enterprise demos with the sales leader and sales engineer to support follow up activities
  • Perform Bocada Cloud demos and after demos, follow up with the lead to answer questions and activate their free account (or trial)
  • After Bocada Enterprise demos, follow up with customers to get MSP program or pilot orders
  • Work with internal subject matter experts to quickly overcome customer objections or respond to questions and opportunities
  • Maintain contact with activated customers during their trials or pilots to assure they convert to paying customers
  • Drive growth and meet monthly and annual sales targets
  • Effectively monitor and accurately forecast sales
  • Work alongside marketing, product and support teams to optimize conversion at each stage of the sales cycle
  • Stay up to date on the features, capabilities and key values of the product and successfully communicate them to prospective customers

Sales Executive Qualifications

  • 8+ years experience in SaaS or enterprise software sales – ideally in the IT operations or security space
  • Confident and comprehensible English language written and verbal communication skills
  • Outstanding at solving business problems, negotiating and collaborating in a global team environment
  • Understanding of backup, data protection, cyber resilience, storage, networking, managed service providers, data centers or other aspects of IT operations
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills
  • Track record of working both independently and with a team

Structure of the Role

  • The position is 100% remote and full-time and exempt
  • Candidate should expect to 08:
    00 to 16:
    00 Brazil time zone (GMT -3)
  • Candidate or Company can provide all necessary computer equipment
  • Employee is responsible for providing a suitable workspace and internet access
  • Candidate will need to be able to work with prospective customers all over the world
  • Base Salary + Commissions (uncapped)

About Bocada

Learn more about Bocada from our LinkedIn page:

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Graphic Designer or Creative Lead, Creative Designer, Senior Designer, and Digital Designer are all alternative job titles that match our client's requirements.

This flexible role can be offered either part-time or full-time with the opportunity to work for a 100% and permanently remote Digital Marketing Agency.

You can be based anywhere with strong/reliable internet connectivity.

A full job description with company info will be provided upon application .

The role manages 12-15 social media content calendars for clients across B2B sectors per month.

Collaborating with the Lead Strategist (former graphic designer) to develop brand identities by executing new concepts, designs of various content types, graphics, social media, email campaigns, website design, and more.

It's 100% digital design for social media posts, website design, posters, etc.

Requirements:


  • Minimum five years of marketing agency or startup experience in a graphic design role is required.
  • Must have experience designing for senior-level accounts.
  • The team is entirely remote -- experience working remotely is necessary.
  • Photoshop, Illustrator, and all graphic design tools expertise are required.
  • Must have video skills, motion graphics, and basic knowledge of UX/web design.
  • Experience working with AI tools to create graphic design and design output.
  • Strategic mindset - the ability to strategically direct what a graphic should look like whenever needed.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present well to clients and internally.
  • Extremely high level of written and oral English communication.


You'll thrive in the environment if you know how to wear multiple hats and love generating ideas and executing them independently.

Knowledge of what it means to design within the B2B sector and be creative even within conservative design limits.

Resourcefulness is essential—you aren't afraid when you don't know how to do something because you usually figure it out on your own.

CV/Resume and online portfolio applications are welcomed. A complete job description with the agency name (website) will be shared before the first interview.

title: Business Development And Account Manager
description:
We are looking for an Business Development and Account Manager (Brazil)

We are looking for a Sales and Account Manager, responsible for Brazil, to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients and actively seek new sales opportunities.

title: Manager, Corporate Development
description:
Manager, Corporate Development


Easy Payroll Global Limited Ireland and their local affiliate ITOS Brasil LTDA is looking to hire a Manager, Corporate Development, to provide services to companies within the Perseus Group (“Perseus”).


Perseus is an Operating Group of Constellation Software Inc. (csisoftware.Com | TSX:
CSU), a Canadian-based publicly held company. Perseus has over 6,000 employees, across 70+ software business units, operating in 12+ software industry verticals, and located in over 40 offices.


Location:
Brazil


The Role:

The services to be provided by the Manager, Corporate Development, encompasses building strong strategic business relationships that lead to the sourcing of current and future M&A opportunities for Perseus. These relationships will be formed with software company decision makers (e.G. CEOs, VPs of Corporate Development, founders, and/or owners) of software companies, M&A advisors, and private equity/ venture capital professionals. Success in this role is defined by building and maintaining meaningful relationships that ultimately lead to Perseus’ acquisition of software companies.


The process of initiating relationships, maintaining relationships, and ultimately making an acquisition typically takes multiple years. Measurable outcomes, continuous value-add through many M&A conversations/ relationships, and high-quality market research are what ultimately generate successful acquisitions through time.


Outcomes:

  • Develop and manage an M&A pipeline through Salesforce CRM and create market maps to build strong relationships in assigned software industry vertical(s).
  • Meet and exceed monthly M&A targets, such as meaningful contacts and other measurable M&A sourcing KPIs.
  • Work both autonomously and with M&A leadership to qualify M&A opportunities with efficiency.
  • Ensure the lead database is allocated accurately within portfolio verticals.
  • Effectively qualify opportunities at the top-end of the acquisition funnel to maintain focus for the Portfolio Managers of the business units.



Relevant Experience & Competencies:

  • At least 3+ years of experience in a Business Development/Sales position at a software company or client-facing M&A/finance role within business development, sales, and/or account management. Preference for experience in outbound-focused origination roles.
  • A clear interest in developing a long-term pipeline of meaningful relationships with prospects as a career trajectory within software investing.
  • Previous high-performance in Business Development, winning in an autonomous role, or prior success in other walks of life outside professional BD experience, such as entrepreneurship, will be considered.
  • Advanced verbal and written communication skills, with the confidence and executive presence to speak with CEOs, M&A advisors, corporate development, private equity and venture capital professionals.
  • Organized, detail-oriented, and able to work variable hours.
  • Extraordinary work ethic, proactive with a sense of urgency.


Other Requirements:

  • This role will require occasional in-person travel, which may include Canada, the U.S., Mexico, Colombia, Chile, and/or Peru, and can be primarily performed remotely.

title: Lead Backend Engineer (Python)
description:
The company and our mission:


Zartis is a digital solutions provider working across technology strategy, software engineering and product development.


We partner with firms across financial services, MedTech, media, logistics technology, renewable energy, EdTech, e-commerce, and more. Our engineering hubs in EMEA and LATAM are full of talented professionals delivering business success and digital improvement across application development, software architecture, CI/CD, business intelligence, QA automation, and new technology integrations.


We are looking for a Lead backend Engineer to work on a project in the data analytics industry.


The project:


Our teammates are talented people that come from a variety of backgrounds. We’re committed to building an inclusive culture based on trust and innovation.

You will be part of a distributed team developing new technologies to solve real business problems. Our client is seeking an energetic individual with experience building cloud-first software in AWS to join their team in developing cutting-edge, custom analytics and data socialization solutions. In this role, you will collaborate with other engineers and teams to build their data socialization and visualization application, Atlas.


What you will do:


  • Collaborate with the team to develop and maintain the backend functionalities of the Atlas platform.
  • Collaborate with the team to develop and maintain AWS platform operations, ensuring robustness and scalability.
  • Write comprehensive unit and integration tests, adhering to best practices in testing.
  • Participate in Code Review and Peer Programming as needed.
  • Collaborate with the Frontend, Data Engineering, and Product teams to align on project requirements and features.
  • Produce Technical Requirements Documents for new features.
  • Schedule and lead design meetings with cross-functional teams.
  • Break down technical epics into manageable stories for estimation and execution.
  • Ensure efficient and effective communication across teams via Slack, Zoom, and email.
  • Understand business requirements and suggest engineering solutions to address business challenges.
  • Engage in client interactions, providing technical insights and support as needed.
  • Participate in an off-hours on-call rotation to provide platform support and address critical issues as they arise.


What you will bring:


  • Proficiency in Cloud technologies (AWS ideally).
  • Experience with Git, CI/CD, Docker.
  • Strong programming skills in high-level languages such as Python, Java, or Golang.
  • Experience working with SQL and KeyStores.
  • Experience in creating and managing Docker containers and using orchestration services like ECS and EKS.
  • Experience building CI/CD pipelines.
  • Advanced relational database design skills.
  • Experience with software design patterns/design idioms in distributed and serverless architectures.


Nice to have:


  • Experience with statistical programming, ideally in R or Python.
  • Development experience in a Linux or Mac environment.
  • Experience with React, Angular, HTML, Javascript/Typescript or other web development tools.
  • Experience with integrating Business Intelligence/Data Visualization tools like Tableau or PowerBI.
  • Experience with Terraform, Snowflake, Databricks, Athena, GraphQL.


What we offer:


  • 100% Remote Work
  • WFH allowance:
     Monthly payment as financial support for remote working.
  • Career Growth:
    We have established a career development program accessible for all employees with a 360º feedback that will help us to guide you in your career progression.
  • Training:
     For Tech training at Zartis, you have time allocated during the week at your disposal. You can request from a variety of options, such as online courses (from Pluralsight and Educative.Io, for example), English classes, books, conferences, and events.
  • Mentoring Program:
     You can become a mentor in Zartis or you can receive mentorship, or both.
  • Zartis Wellbeing Hub (Kara Connect) :
    A platform that provides sessions with a range of specialists, including mental health professionals, nutritionists, physiotherapists, fitness coaches, and webinars with such professionals as well.
  • Flexible Working schedule .
  • Multicultural working environment:
    We organize tech events, webinars, parties, and activities to do online team-building games and contests.

title: Technical Solutions Engineer - Databricks
description:
Revolutionize Data Solutions:
Join Our Team as a DatabricksTechnical Solutions Engineer!

Are you passionate about cutting-edge data technologies and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? We're seeking a highly skilled Technical Solutions Engineer to empower our customers to unlock the full potential of the Databricks unified analytics platform. In this role, you'll be a technical expert, providing solutions and guidance to address complex challenges related to Spark, Machine Learning, AI, Delta Lake, Streaming, and Lakehouse architectures. You'll play a crucial role in ensuring our customers achieve their strategic goals and maximize the value of our products.

Make a Real Impact:

  • Dive Deep into Spark:
     Analyze and troubleshoot complex Spark issues using performance metrics, DAGs, and event logs, identifying root causes of job slowness and performance bottlenecks.
  • Expert Problem Solver:
     Provide deep code-level analysis and solutions for customer challenges related to Spark core internals, Spark SQL, Structured Streaming, Delta Lake, Lakehouse, and other Databricks runtime features.
  • Empower Our Customers:
     Assist customers in reproducing and resolving Spark problems, offering expert guidance in areas like Spark SQL, Delta Lake, memory management, performance tuning, streaming, data science, and data integration.
  • Lead the Way:
     Participate in our Designated Solutions Engineer program, mentoring and guiding strategic customers on their daily Spark and cloud-related challenges.
  • Collaborate and Communicate:
     Work closely with Account Executives, Customer Success Engineers, and Resident Solution Architects to coordinate customer issues and share best practices. Actively participate in screen sharing sessions, Slack discussions, and other communication channels.
  • Knowledge Sharer:
     Develop and maintain internal wikis, knowledge bases, and technical documentation to empower both support teams and customers. Contribute to company documentation and knowledge base articles.
  • Continuous Improvement:
     Collaborate with Engineering and Backline Support teams to report product defects and drive improvements.
  • Be Part of the Team:
     Participate in weekend and weekday on-call rotations, managing escalations during runtime outages and critical incidents, ensuring seamless customer operations.

What You'll Bring:

  • Hands-on Expertise:
     3+ years of experience developing production-scale applications using two or more of the following technologies:
    Big Data, Hadoop, Spark (mandatory), Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Streaming, Kafka, Data Science, or Elasticsearch.
  • Spark Mastery:
     Proven experience in performance tuning and troubleshooting Hive and Spark-based applications in a production environment.
  • JVM and Memory Management:
     Real-world experience with JVM and memory management techniques, including garbage collection and heap/thread dump analysis.
  • Database Proficiency:
     Experience with SQL-based databases, data warehousing/ETL technologies (e.G., Informatica, DataStage, Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server, MySQL), and SCD-type use cases.
  • Cloud Experience:
     Familiarity with AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms.
  • Excellent Communication:
     Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.
  • Problem-Solving Prowess:
     A passion for solving challenging technical problems and a commitment to customer success.

Join us and be at the forefront of data innovation!

title: Testing & Commissioning Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced Testing and commissioning Engineer to join our dynamic team for Data Center projects in Brazil. This position demands a solid foundation in electrical engineering, particularly in testing and Commissioning power generation equipment. The ideal candidate will ensure that all equipment and systems adhere to Industry standards and regulatory requirements through thorough and safe testing processes. Responsibilities will encompass managing all aspects of testing, including Factory acceptance Tests (FAT), Site acceptance Tests (Sat), and Integrated Systems Tests (IST). The engineer should be proficient in developing and executing test plans That align with customer needs while maintaining clear communication with the factory.


Key responsibilities:

  • Actual participation in testing and commissioning activities including FAT, SAT, and IST;
  • Ensure adherence to industry regulations and safety standards during testing and commissioning processes;
  • Develop and implement testing protocols to validate system functionality and performance according to customer specificity;
  • Diagnose and resolve technical issues related to testing and commissioning;
  • Collaborate with project teams to incorporate testing and commissioning activities into overall project plans;
  • Preparing project documentation, including test reports, commissioning plans, and equipment manuals;
  • Participate in project meetings and effectively communicate with stakeholders to achieve project goals.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field is preferred;
  • Proven experience in testing and commissioning power generator preferred;
  • Familiarity with industry standards and regulations related to electrical testing and commissioning (E.G., IEEE, IEC, NEC);
  • Strong troubleshooting abilities and capacity to analyze complex electrical systems;
  • Experience in project management or coordination is a plus;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to workindependently and as part of a team;
  • Strong commitment to safety and quality;
  • This position may require travel to project sites or customer locations, both locally and internationally as needed.

*Please note that this is a 1 year renewable contract position*

title: Business Development Manager (Brazil)
description:
To cater to our business expansions, we are now hiring high caliber talents to join our growing team, together with our current talent forces to support the business strategies, goals and initiatives.


What are your responsibilities?

  • Identify and assess potential partnership and introducing brokers' opportunities for integration into the company.

Who are we looking for?

title: Government Relations Manager
description:
As a highly-regarded high-tech unicorn company, inDrive has been making a positive global impact since 2013. Harnessing the power of innovative mobile technologies, our core product is redefining ride-hailing, while simultaneously introducing new business verticals that are propelling us toward becoming a super app. With our cutting-edge solutions and dynamic work environment, we provide a unique opportunity for individuals to contribute to our mission of combating injustice on a global scale.


About the opportunity:

We are looking for a Government Relations Manager for Brazil with a solid experience in addressing complex regulatory issues and establishing sustainable relations with the regulators and key opinion leaders. This position is needed to represent and advance inDrive’s interests in Brazil with national and state authorities and key opinion leaders.


What you will do:

  • Cultivate and maintain strategic relationships with government officials, policymakers, regulatory bodies, and key industry leaders in Brazil.
  • Oversee platform licensing at the state level, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements across Ride-hailing, Couriers, Intercity, Cargo, and other business verticals operated by inDrive. Manage the full licensing process, from identification to execution.
  • Develop and implement a national government relations (GR) strategy, including setting objectives, key results (OKRs), and detailed roadmaps and action plans.
  • Foster partnerships with key policy stakeholders, including businesses, trade associations, and civil society organizations.
  • Lead inDrive’s involvement with NGOs, industry unions, and associations.
  • Identify and assess regulatory risks and opportunities, and develop strategies to address them effectively.
  • Manage regulatory and political crises, formulating and executing action plans to mitigate impact.
  • Strengthen inDrive’s brand and visibility among policymakers, governments, third parties, thought leaders, and academic institutions.
  • Advocate for a regulatory environment in each market that supports and enables the growth of technology platforms like inDrive.
  • Formulate and manage the country-level GR budget.
  • Provide strategic guidance to internal stakeholders on policy, legislative, or reputational matters that may influence business performance and corporate reputation.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Growth, Legal, Communications, Finance, and Product) to ensure regulatory compliance and proactively address potential regulatory challenges.


What we expect from you:

  • 10+ years of experience in government relations, public policy, or a related field.
  • At least 3 years of experience in a tier-one multinational organization, either in-house or as a consultant, is highly desirable.
  • A degree in Law, Economics, Political Science, International Affairs, or a related field.
  • Proven track record in designing and executing public policy strategies and managing complex advocacy initiatives at both national and regional levels.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Portuguese and English, with a demonstrated ability to engage with diverse partners on policy issues. Comfort in participating in challenging or controversial debates is essential.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
*Please attach an English resume when you apply for this position.


Qualifications

  • Administering cloud-based Infrastructure deployment which includes tasks such as provisioning/de-provisioning of resources, maintaining security posture, user administration, monitoring computing resource utilization, network setup, backup/restore and incident management.
  • Performs system administration activities in accordance with company policies and procedures.
  • Troubleshoot, performs root cause analysis, implements corrective/preventive actions during and after an incident.
  • Create and maintain documentation and processes for troubleshooting, maintaining, and configuring systems.
  • Support audit and infrastructure/network security scans, disaster recovery and security related drills.
  • Collaborate with internal teams and project team to fix and improve products.
  • Follow up with clients to ensure our systems are fully functional after troubleshooting.
  • Explore, learn and deploy new technologies that will help the company to reduce cost or improve operational efficiencies.


Requirements

  • Experience in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Openstack, GCP, etc.), Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes etc.)
  • Demonstrate strong knowledge in infrastructure areas such as virtual server technologies, networking, internet protocols, scripting & monitoring tools and IT Security.
  • Advanced python/ansible scripting skills for provisioning and automating dynamic cloud infrastructure.
  • Hands-on experience with Docker containerization and Kubernetes orchestration preferred.
  • Experience using cloud system monitoring tools (e.G. zabbix, Prometheus, nagios etc.) and automated testing frameworks or scripts.
  • Experience with common service (e.G. MQ, Redis, ES).
  • Experience with relational databases (e.G. MySQL, Oracle, Sqlserver) and NoSQL databases (e.G. MongoDB).
  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery technologies and tools experience is preferred, such as Jenkins.
  • AWS Certified Solution Architect (Associate) preferred.
  • Strong analytical, change management, communications and interpersonal skills.

R$11.300,00 - R$17.000,00 per month

title: Customer Support Representative
description:
Teamified works with top enterprises and digital native businesses in Australia helping them build their remote teams in Brazil, Egypt, India, Philippines and Sri Lanka. We pride ourselves with hiring great teams to work on exciting game changing technology. Teamified currently has 200+ engineers, testers, product managers etc. working across 20+ partners. We focus on uplifting the way organisations build and manage their remote teams through great working relationships, trust, integrity, culture and hiring processes. Additional to this we are building our own technology product offerings. We strive to deliver the best outcomes for our customers, our partners and our people.


Job Summary:

Our client’s mission is to mold a new financial system, built on the ethos of the Internet. The Internet is open and instant. It doesn’t care for where you were born, where you live or which passport you hold.

On the Internet, you can express ideas, be a creator, trade with anyone, and deliver services across the world. Sadly, finance is far from this. Billions of people are part of the Internet economy, but when they move money, they still face all the challenges of legacy banking. Stablecoins change everything. It’s where finance meets the Internet. Anyone, anywhere can be paid, save, invest and spend instantly.

Without a bank. Our client is building a stablecoin-powered platform, for people everywhere.


Position Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and customer-focused Customer Service Representative with a strong background in finance, particularly Cryptocurrency. This role involves providing exceptional customer support while addressing inquiries related to financial products and services. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a solid understanding of financial principles, and the ability to resolve issues efficiently and professionally.


Key Responsibilities:

1. Customer Support:

  • Respond to customer inquiries regarding financial products, accounts, and transactions via phone, email, or chat.
  • Provide accurate and clear explanations of financial processes and policies.
  • Resolve customer complaints and issues promptly, ensuring satisfaction and compliance with financial regulations.

2. Financial Expertise:

  • Assist customers with finance-specific needs, including payments, account management, and product recommendations.
  • Identify discrepancies in accounts and collaborate with the finance team for resolution.
  • Stay updated on company financial products, industry trends, and regulatory requirements.

3. Problem Solving and Resolution:

  • Handle escalated issues related to finance with a focus on providing effective and timely solutions.
  • Identify recurring issues and recommend process improvements to enhance customer experience.

4. Data Management and Reporting:

  • Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and financial transactions.
  • Prepare reports on common financial inquiries and resolutions to support team improvements.

5. Collaboration and Communication:

  • Liaise with internal teams, such as finance and compliance, to ensure seamless resolution of complex issues.
  • Communicate updates on financial policies or changes to customers and colleagues as needed.

Key Skills and Key Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in customer service, preferably within the finance or banking industry.
  • Strong understanding of financial products, services, and regulations.
  • Proficiency in customer service tools, CRM software, and financial systems.
  • Exceptional communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
  • Ability to handle confidential financial information with discretion and professionalism.
  • Customer-focused with strong interpersonal skills.
  • Analytical and detail-oriented, especially in handling financial matters.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and work efficiently under pressure.
  • Proactive and resourceful in resolving customer inquiries and issues.
  • Ability to work in shifts.


Benefits:

- Flexibility in work hours and location, with a focus on managing energy rather than time.

- Access to online learning platforms and a budget for professional development

- A collaborative, no-silos environment, encouraging learning and growth across teams

- A dynamic social culture with team lunches, social events, and opportunities for creative input


If you possess the required skills and are eager to contribute to our team's success, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Customer Service Representative. Apply now!

title: Head Accountant
description:
Chief Accountant – iGaming

Salary:
Negotiable, dependent on experience

Location :
Sao Paulo, Brazil

Company :
Leading B2B Software Provider in the iGaming Sector


Are you an experienced accounting professional ready to take on a pivotal role with a global iGaming software leader? We are looking for a Chief Accountant to join our Sao Paulo team and drive excellence in financial operations, compliance, and reporting.


Key Responsibilities

  • Manage daily accounting, bookkeeping, and invoicing for our local entity.
  • Implement and oversee Accounts Payable processes, ensuring seamless monthly closings with accurate calculations and postings.
  • Reconcile balance sheet accounts and handle group reporting through the Cognos consolidation tool.
  • Maintain compliance with local legislation, IFRS standards, and best practices for daily accounting.
  • Assist in audits, preparing essential documents, and managing auditor queries.
  • Oversee fixed asset and low-value stock accounting, register updates, and purchase documentation.
  • Maintain vendor reconciliations, review and authorize payment proposals, and submit payment requests to the bank.
  • Collaborate with payroll accountants, manage payroll, and approve all outgoing payments (payroll, invoices, taxes).
  • Handle cash flow management, including monthly cash flow forecasts and resource planning for timely invoice payments.
  • ERP - Microsoft Narvision experience preferable.


Qualifications

  • Experience :
    5+ years as an Accounting Manager or Senior Accountant, preferably in an international company.
  • Education :
    Professional accounting certification.
  • Technical Skills :
    Deep understanding of local tax and accounting legislation, IFRS standards, and complex finance systems. Experience with MS Navision / Business Central is a plus, especially with implementation projects.
  • Language :
    Fluent in both Portuguese and English (spoken and written).
  • Other Skills :
    Strong analytical skills, multi-tasking abilities, adaptability, advanced Microsoft Excel and computer skills.


As the Chief Accountant, you will play a crucial role in our financial operations. Additional tasks may be assigned based on business needs. Join us for an exciting journey in a high-impact role where your expertise will make a difference!

title: Accounting Manager
description:
**Job Responsibility:
**

1. **Daily Accounting Operations:
** Complete monthly closing tasks on time as per the requirements of the headquarters.

1) Responsible for the verification and checking of account receivables and account payables transactions.

2) Follow up on monthly closing tasks, resolve any issues encountered during the closing process, and ensure the completion of the closing tasks as required.

2. **Preparation of Local Financial Statements:
** Timely and accurately complete the financial accounting according to local accounting standards and related laws and regulations, provide individual financial statements on time, and complete the annual audit report.

3. **Internal Management Reporting:
** Provide various management analysis reports as required, such as capital management, receivables management, gross profit management, pricing management, and foreign exchange gain/loss management.

4. **System Development and Process Control:
**

1) Revise the accounting policies based on CAS 、IFRS requirements and the headquarters' policies.

2) Assist in building and optimizing the financial IT platform to improve overall work quality and operational efficiency.

5. **Other Project Requirements:
** Carry out other financial related tasks as needed by various projects.


**Job Requirement:
**

1. 3-5 years of accounting experience, possessing solid accounting knowledge and good financial analysis skills, with experience in the manufacturing industry preferred.

2. Bachelor's degree or above, preferably in accounting or related fields.

3. Local candidates, with good English communication skills, ability to work under pressure, and strong team collaboration skills.

4. Proficient in using office software and familiar with ERP (Oracle) systems is a plus.

title: Engineering Leader, Technical Due Diligence (Renewable Energy)
description:
A mission driven Global Leader in independent engineering and technical advisory for the renewable energy industry, is hiring for their Due Diligence Technical Advisory business in Latin America across Solar, Storage and Wind projects.


The Engineering Leader will lead a highly collaborative team, at a point of real growth and opportunity across the region, but based out of Brazil.


This is a high profile, strategic position that offers a technically capable leader exciting scope in a Global business (Reporting to the Global Head of Renewables).


This role is based out of their established Sao Paolo, Brazil office, with business travel and work outside of the office as required. Excellent communication skills are required in Portuguese, plus English and Spanish requirements to manage people in the region and to collaborate internationally.


Core Responsibilities of the successful postholder:


Oversee Engineering Due Diligence reviews and Technical Advisory initiatives for project financing and M&A transactions. Play a pivotal role in reviewing and innovating on cutting edge operational strategies in pursuit of accurate assessments.


Compile comprehensive IE and TA reports, integrating insights from multidisciplinary teams. Ensure top-tier quality and consistency in technical and commercial analyses to exceed client expectations.


Manage and schedule internal resources. Ensure project deliverables stay on time, on target, and on budget.


Mentor and train junior staff and assume responsibility for the internal growth of the team.


Drive financial success with full P&L responsibility, developing and executing revenue and business plans while identifying growth opportunities in the region. Accountable for ensuring financial targets (revenue, profit, enterprise value, etc.) for Due Diligence are met.


Anticipate customer needs by creating strong partnerships with Sales and Business Development.

Work with lenders and developers as the main client interface for the business. Attend meetings, lead discussions, and build lasting partnerships.


Qualifications/skills of the successful postholder:


  • University degree (equivalent to a bachelor’s degree) in Engineering or related field
  • An expectation of 10 years directly related experience in Renewables specifically in Solar, including at least five years of people management and leadership experience.
  • An excellent communicator to technical and commercial decision makers, owners, operators, lenders as well as to investors.
  • Excellent communication skills in English, plus Portuguese and Spanish


#EngineeringLeader #DueDiligence #Solar

title: Accountant
description:
Accountant, Brazil (F/M/D)


Company:

Fime enables its clients to create and launch trusted and secure solutions with consulting and testing services in payments, smart mobility, biometrics, and authentication. With 800+ experts around the world in over 20 locations, Fime is a multi-cultural global leading player its industry.


Inspired by our talented people, we are empowered to take ownership and innovate for the benefit of our clients. title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Pluxee is a global leader in employee benefits and engagement, operating in 31 countries. We help companies attract, engage, and retain top talent through a diverse range of solutions, including Food & Meal Benefits, Well-being, Lifestyle Perks, Rewards & Recognition, and Public Benefits.


Powered by cutting-edge technology and a passionate team of 5,000+ professionals, Pluxee thrives in a highly interconnected B2B2C ecosystem—serving 500,000+ clients, 36 million consumers, and 1.7 million merchants.


For over 45 years, we’ve been a trusted partner, creating a positive impact on businesses, employees, and communities. From boosting local economies to enhancing workplace well-being—all while protecting the planet—Pluxee is committed to making a difference.


We’re looking for a strategic and dynamic Product Marketing Manager to drive awareness, engagement, and growth for our new product lines. This role is perfect for a creative thinker with strong communication skills and deep market insights.


Reporting to the Country Marketing Director , you’ll lead and execute high-impact marketing strategies that deliver measurable results. You’ll refine go-to-market approaches, product positioning, and brand messaging based on data-driven insights while working cross-functionally with key teams.

title: Back End Developer
description:
About the Company

Excent Capital Ltd is a regulated investment broker with offices in London, Seychelles, Mexico, and São Paulo, with expansion plans worldwide. We provide our clients with an investment platform for the international financial market. Due to our continuous growth, we are looking for:

Backend Developer - Django/Python


Job Description

The candidate will be responsible for the development, architecture, implementation, and maintenance of the REST API service. This role requires a deep understanding of Python and Django. The ideal profile is a proactive person with initiative, a problem-solving mindset, and a passion for tackling the challenges of complex development. Since this is an internal project, we aim to build a team of specialists in each area to ensure we have the necessary skill set for the best possible development.

 This position is for our Mexico City office . The company will handle all Relocation and VISA processes for international candidates.

  • Develop and maintain the Back-End infrastructure and REST API.

title: Retention Team Lead
description:
Kaspersky has been protecting individuals and corporate clients all over the world from cyber threats for 27 years.

We have 400 million unique users, 270 000 corporate clients, 517 products, 1100 technological patents and 34 offices around the world.


Today our team has more than 5 000 top level experts, all of them regular people with their own talents and hobbies.

Together we protect the world from cyber threats.

title: Helpdesk Lead, Corporate It
description:
Corporate IT is the backbone of our business. Our team helps the company to develop a competitive advantage through defining our technology objectives, assessing solution options, and devising technical solutions that help us achieve both strategic goals and meet operational requirements. As a part of our team, you’ll help deliver seamless IT experiences and support to our internal employees by providing responsive helpdesk service, stable networks and reliable IT systems.


As a Helpdesk Lead, you will be responsible for managing a team of skilled helpdesk engineers and analysts, ensuring the seamless delivery of IT support services to our diverse workforce. You will play a crucial role in maintaining the efficiency and productivity of our IT systems, fostering a positive work environment, and continuously improving our support processes.


Job Description:

  • Team Leadership:
  • Lead and mentor a team of helpdesk engineers and analysts.
  • Foster a collaborative and positive work environment.
  • Conduct regular team meetings and performance reviews.
  • Technical Oversight:
  • Oversee day-to-day IT support operations, ensuring prompt issue resolution.
  • Collaborate with other IT teams to address complex technical challenges.
  • Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging technologies.
  • Process Improvement:
  • Identify areas for process improvement and implement efficiency measures.
  • Develop and document IT support procedures and protocols.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to gather feedback and enhance service delivery.
  • Collaboration:
  • Collaborate with regional IT teams to align strategies and goals.
  • Liaise with department heads to understand their IT needs and provide tailored solutions.
  • Communication and End-User Support:
  • Ensure timely and effective communication with end-users throughout the problem resolution process.
  • Resource Management:
  • Manage workload distribution and skill development of team members.
  • Coordinate training programs to keep the team updated on the latest technologies and methodologies.
  • Documentation and Asset Management:
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of IT systems, processes, and configurations.
  • Handle IT asset management and liaise with stakeholders to ensure sufficient devices for the business.


Job Requirements:

  • Diploma or degree in Computer Sciences, Information Technology, or a related field preferred.
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in a similar role.
  • In-depth knowledge of computer hardware, software, and OS (Windows and macOS).
  • Strong understanding of ITIL framework and best practices.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a diverse team.
  • Fluent in Portuguese and English.
  • Understanding of TCP/IP, IP addressing, and LAN technology, including switching and routing fundamentals is a plus.
  • Hands-on experience in Windows server administration and basic knowledge in Linux server administration is a plus.
  • Professional Qualification - Microsoft Certified/CCNA is a plus.
  • Ability to cover after-office hours and weekend support if there are any infrastructure issues or activities.
  • Enthusiastic and willing to learn in a fluid and fast-paced environment.
  • Passionate about IT technology and committed to making a difference with technology solutions.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills to interact effectively at all levels.
  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.

title: Kcf & Rr Facilitation Senior
description:
Are you our new colleague?

We’re looking for a KCF & RR facilitation senior at Randstad Global

Sao Paolo, Brasil, hybrid, fulltime


BR&AF

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR&AF’s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on:
the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Group’s in-control statements.

The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control & audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.G. digital, talent, client, back office & shared service centers and fraud & forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk & audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning & development, quality improvement & methods, analytics and PMO.

Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR&A Partners and support group) form the BR&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR&AF.


how you will contribute

You are part of the Business Risk & Audit Function (BR&AF) that covers all business operations related to Clients, Talents and our (shared) Back-, Mid- and Front offices, as well as our Accounting & Reporting and other specialist functions like HR. With your interpersonal and project support skills you are a key enabler of the operational success of the function.


As KCF & RR facilitation senior you:

  • coordinate and facilitate the operational execution of the management control framework management self assessment process
  • coordinate and facilitate the operational execution of ongoing enterprise risk assessment activities.
  • enable reporting for both enterprise risk assessments as well as management control framework assessment results
  • are willing to travel. As the standard office locations for the BR&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.


what you will be doing

In your role as KCF and RR facilitator you:

  • technically enable and support the execution of internal control framework (KCF) self assessment and enterprise risk management
  • as part of a wider GRC support team ensure data quality checks are in place and data is consolidated in support of integrated analytics initiatives
  • support integrated analyses and reporting by designing and rolling out new analytical concepts and reports
  • support the day to day operations of GRC (audit, risk, control) and analytics tooling
  • support projects that are aimed to further automated key BR&AF processes


who will you work with

  • MD BR&AF
  • BR&AF MT
  • business risk & audit Partners
  • focus team teams
  • control assessors throughout the company


what you will bring

Your hands-on and in-depth understanding of supporting and managing global operations in combination with a lean way of thinking translates into a service oriented approach in which you bring effectiveness, efficiency and positive client experience together. You constantly seek ways to reduce workloads yet increase the value creation. you are vocal on the different clients of the processes you operate and you actively try to find a balance in optimizing the experience for all.


As a KCF & RR facilitation senior you:

  • have minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience
  • have college or university degree or the equivalent work experience
  • have level BEC B1/B2 or higher Business English
  • have a strong independent mindset
  • are experienced in international stakeholder management & change
  • are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo
  • have an agile and flexible working style and passion being the "spider in the web" and getting things done
  • define a pragmatic, realistic yet ambitious vision on planning the staff members and getting all projects and audits done
  • deliver full usages of all team members by coordinating their planning that is updated frequently ensuring people are timely informed and ready to start their assignments.
  • work with people and engage them on the job ahead
  • effectively connect and take people with different backgrounds allowing cross functional experts to take ownership of initiatives and projects.


your competencies

Within Randstad we defined the following Leadership competencies:

  • delighting people:
    connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client-centric solutions.
  • performing today:
    resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
  • leading change:
    manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
  • securing the future:
    drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.
  • creating clarity - showing line of sight:
    making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
  • courage to challenge:
    shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances
  • collaborates, reaches out, you excel in organizational sensitivity:
    maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization


what’s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here .

If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role.


people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website:


For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner:


The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.

title: Treasury Manager
description:
**Job Responsibility:
**

1、Cash Management

Independently manage subjects related to daily operations of in-country cash pools (if any) and coordinate cash repatriation initiatives with the local team;
Lead cash flow forecastprocess with local teams;
Conduct investment activities for surplus funds, if any.

2、Financing

Arrange necessary credit lines to support business growth and closely monitor their utilization;
Coordinate on capital injection process, including to ensure internal controls and local regulatory compliances.

3、Financial Institution Relationship Management

Act as the main contact for banks and ensure their sound service;
Coordinate bank interfaces with IT / ERP teams;
Stay up-to-date with market evolution to apply suitable solutions to our business all the time.

4、FX Risk Management

Ensure smooth FX hedging / spot activities, including developing the most optimized strategies, setting up necessary bank / internal facilities, ensure proper operations at all times. Provide necessary guidance / training to entities to ensure a proper FX risk management process;

5、Insurance

Act as insurance correspondent of the countries in scope, including correct & timely reporting / declaration, insurance program


**Job Requirement:
**

1、Bachelor degree with a prestigious university major in Finance / Economics. Master degree a plus. More than 5 years in treasury function of multination company.

2、Relevant experience in financial institutions could be considered for good candidates too.

3、Good in excel Fluent in English a must. Chinese a plus.

4、CTP, ACCA, CFA and CPA are plus Detailed, organized, sense of responsibility, team play, and able to learn.

description:

title: Customer Success & Solutions Manager
description:
Responsibilities

To handle the end-to-end customer journey from presales requirements gathering and solution design, to the project delivery and subsequent customer success and maintenance, as follows:

  1. Presales:
  • Design AI Talkbot solutions for large enterprise customers, aligning product capabilities with customer business needs to highlight value and secure buy-in.
  • Define product and service scope, establishing clear boundaries for solution integration, customization, and the interface between the company's products and customer systems.


  1. Solution Delivery:
  • Lead project management for delivery and on-site integration projects, including requirement communication, project planning, team coordination, progress promotion, leadership, and risk management until final delivery.


  1. Customer Success:
  • Maintain regular client engagement through quarterly business reviews and product training.
  • Manage change requests and incident responses per SLA, utilizing product and client business knowledge for effective problem-solving.
  • Analyze usage data and business metrics to enhance product adoption and prevent churn.
  • Identify and address gaps between client expectations and solution performance, mobilizing internal resources or leading optimization efforts as needed.
  • Understand customer needs and conduct upselling based on customer fit and growth stage.

Candidate requirements

  • Degree in Business Management, Technology, or related fields;
  • More than five years of experience in consulting, account management, software project management or solution-related work;
  • Prior experience and understanding of fintech, banking, telecommunications or martech industries, or enterprise service or enterprise sales experience would be a plus;
  • Strong sense ofcreating value for customers, excellent systematic and logical thinking ability, can quickly understand the product and the customer's original business system;
  • Strong communications with customers, partners and internal cross-departments;

title: Cleaning Validation Specialist Ireland
description:

Who are we?

We provide cloud-based software solutions for Quality Management and Regulatory Inspections, pharmaceuticals contract manufacturing professionals, and metrology services to our clients.

‘Take your Career to a new Level’

We offer a permanent contract of employment giving exposure of working in Top Pharmaceutical client sites in a diverse-cultural work setting.

Employee Value Proposition

Employees are the “heartbeat” of PSC Biotech, we provide unparalleled empowering career development though Learning & Development inhouse training mentorship through constant guidance to facilitate career progression. We believe in creating high performing teams that can exceed our client’s expectations with regards to quality of all scalable and business unit deliverables, staying under budget and ensuring timelines for our deliverables are being met.

Cleaning Validation Executor

  • Experience in aseptic technique.
  • Experience in Gowning for IOS7/ISO8.
  • Generating and Executing Validation Protocols.
  • Actively look for Continuous improvements.

  • Experienced Technical writer.
  • Experience in Deviation/Change control writing,
  • Capable of managing a large program, so project management skills would be necessary.

  • Generate/review/Approval of CV protocols.
  • Generate Reports.

  • Ensure Training is maintained and current.

Education and Experience:

  • Experienced in QA Validation activities.
  • Execution of cleaning validation protocols.
  • Experience on writing and approving Deviations/ GMP documents.
  • Technical writing experience in writing site reports.
