title: Test Engineer
description:
Test Engineer - High-Tech Industry (English Speakers)

Location:
The Netherlands (on-site), 1 year contract with potential of permanent employment, NOT project/freelance


About the Company:

We are a leading company in high-tech manufacturing, developing and testing cutting-edge technologies that have a global impact. Our work pushes the boundaries of engineering and innovation. We are looking for Test Engineers who are passionate about precision, problem-solving, and ensuring high-quality production through rigorous testing methodologies. Join our team and contribute to the future of high-tech manufacturing.


Role and Responsibilities:


As a Test Engineer , you will play a key role in verifying and validating high-tech systems to ensure they meet the highest industry standards. You will work closely with development, production, and quality teams to identify, analyze, and resolve technical issues. Your primary goal is to enhance the reliability and functionality of complex systems through systematic testing and continuous improvement initiatives.


Your daily responsibilities will include:

  • Performing functional and performance testing on high-tech systems to ensure compliance with design specifications.
  • Analyzing test data and troubleshooting mechanical, electrical, and software-related issues.
  • Collaborating with engineering and production teams to address recurring issues and implement corrective actions.
  • Developing and optimizing automated test procedures to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
  • Supporting first-line troubleshooting and providing technical guidance for production teams.
  • Documenting test results, defects, and improvements , ensuring clear communication between departments.
  • Driving continuous improvement initiatives to optimize test strategies and system performance.


What We’re Looking For:


We seek recent graduates or engineers with 1-3 years of experience who are eager to apply their skills in a high-tech testing environment. If you enjoy solving complex technical problems and working with cutting-edge technology, this role is an excellent opportunity for you.


Essential Requirements:


  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a technical field such as Mechanical Engineering, Electronics, Mechatronics, Applied Physics, or related disciplines .
  • Hands-on experience in a testing or troubleshooting environment involving high-tech products.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a solid understanding of engineering principles.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, or C++.
  • Fluency in English is required.
  • A proactive mindset, willingness to learn, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Skills & Qualities You’ll Need to Succeed:


  • Strong attention to detail and an ability to analyze complex data effectively.
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills to collaborate with diverse teams.
  • A hands-on approach with a pragmatic attitude toward troubleshooting and optimization.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks while maintaining high-quality standards.
  • Willingness to contribute to continuous improvement and efficiency optimization.


What You’ll Love About This Job:


  • Innovative Work Environment :
    Be part of a team working with groundbreaking technology and solving unique engineering challenges.
  • Collaborative Culture :
    Work closely with a diverse team of experts in a supportive and dynamic setting.
  • Career Growth :
    Gain valuable experience with opportunities for professional development in the high-tech industry.
  • Flexible Working Conditions :
    Work in a modern, flexible environment designed for efficiency and collaboration.


Context of the position:


  • The Test Engineer role is essential in validating and optimizing NXE and EXE systems .
  • Most issues (80%) are resolved by first-line engineers , while 20% require specialist intervention from the test team.
  • The Test Engineer reports to the Test Engineering Group Lead and works closely with Manufacturing and R&D teams .
  • Work schedule:
     Shift-based system, including occasional evening and weekend shifts (no night shifts).
  • Occasional travel may be required for urgent escalations at customer sites.
  • Employees receive a mobile phone and laptop and work in an Activity-Based Working office .


If any of the below competencies match your experience, then you are who we are looking for!


  • Programming & Automation:
     Python, C++, MATLAB, LabVIEW
  • Data Analysis & Optimization:
     Proficiency in Excel, Simulink, or Tableau
  • Testing & Calibration:
     Hands-on experience with validation of complex systems
  • Embedded Systems:
     Experience in hardware/software integration
  • Mechanical & Electrical Design:
     Familiarity with CAD tools (SolidWorks, AutoCAD) or circuit design software (Altium, Eagle)
  • System Integration:
     Understanding of integrating various high-tech systems

Who is Xelvin?

Xelvin is a Dutch consultancy company specializing in Engineering and Technical Trades. We hire Artisans, National Degree, Bachelor, Masters and PHD candidates with a background in Mechatronics, Electronics, Electrical, Mechanical, Automotive and Physics. Our focus is within the High-Tech and Manufacturing industry.

Xelvin is specialized in International Recruitment, within Europe and beyond. In the past years we have helped over a thousand candidates from more than 50 different nationalities with finding their perfect job here in the Netherlands and are striving to help so many more!

As Xelvin we hire candidates for a specific position for a set amount of time, after which a permanent contract with our client is granted and the candidates automatically transfers.


What do we offer?

Contract wise:

· 1-year contract of 40 hours per week (with potential of long-term employment).

· 25 paid holidays a year (+ potential ADV days)

· Public holidays, with a maximum of 7 per year, which are paid by Xelvin.

· Holiday allowance of 8.33% (instead of 8,0%) over your total gross annual income. Paid each year in May.

· Overtime and shift allowance will be paid by Xelvin accordingly.

· Travel allowance of €0,23 per km, for the use of travelling to work and back home.

· The salary will range from €3600 to €4600 gross (plus shift allowance if applicable)


Onboarding & benefits:

· Finding your 1st accommodation in the Netherlands will be supported by Xelvin, with the help of our Housing Consultant (we help you find accommodation). In case of having to pay the 1st months rent or potential deposit, Xelvin is willing to pay it for you upfront, after which we’ll set up a loan agreement, for you to pay us back in terms.

· Xelvin is certified to do VISA applications for you and your family and get your work permit in order so you can travel and start working (if required).

· A relocation assistance allowance of €1000 - €1500 NET will be paid to you, to assist with the cost of relocating to the Netherlands.

· You (and your family/partner) will be picked up at the airport or train station by your consultant/ recruiter after your arrival and will be taken to your new house.

· Onboarding:
we’ll advise you on how to set up a Dutch bank account, apply for health insurance, getting a Dutch BSN number, writing in with a dentist and general practitioner and other useful or necessary cases to arrange.

· New Hire Dinner organized for all newly recruited engineers to make them aware of our Dutch tax system and explaining the Dutch payslip.

· A few social gatherings with all Xelvin employees and recruited engineers;

. New Years drinkat the local PSV stadium, where you’ll get a tour of the building and beverages and bites are served.

. Summer BBQ at the Evoluon, where you can grow your social circle and dance to some nice music while enjoying the food.

title: It Risk & Audit Professional
description:
Are you our new colleague?

We’re looking for a IT risk & audit professional at Randstad Global

Sao Paolo, Brazil, hybrid, fulltime


BR&AF

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR&AF’s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on:
the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Group’s in-control statements.


The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control & audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.G. digital, talent, client, back office & shared service centers and fraud & forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk & audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning & development, quality improvement & methods, analytics and PMO.

Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR&A Partners and support group) form the BR&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR&AF.


how you will contribute

As IT auditor you are part of the, Business Risk & Audit - IT focus team and are going to:

  • perform and assist internal audit projects and internal control evaluation related to 'digital' processes, such as general IT processes, IT program & project management, 3rd party assurance, security, business IT (automated) controls, RPA, AI and BCP.
  • together with other team members you coordinate, execute and report on the outcomes of risk management, internal control and internal audit in close collaboration with other involved and impacted functions within the group, such as IT and global IT program organizations
  • provide coaching & development for your team members with respect to IT general controls, application controls and other technical expertise's required within Risk & Audit.
  • support the planning, execution and reporting of the risk, internal control and internal audit activities in your domain to make impact. You know your impact is there when management follows-up on your reports by implementing operational and control improvements.


what you will be doing

  • participate in risk assessments and assist in audit planning and scoping, such as:
    IT general controls, automated controls, RPA and IT projects.
  • perform IT controls/process audits on scope elements.
  • lead and execute audits, for technical domains, including:
    physical security, ethical hacking and technical validation of controls on multiple OSI layers.
  • support combined comfort analyses on maturity of IT general controls relevant domains (combining audit insights with other sources of data such as internal control projects, management controls self-assessment and developments within the company)
  • participate and lead audit interviews, accountable to prepare audit workpapers and reporting, as well as assist in drafting audit findings and recommendations for management based on identified control weaknesses or process improvements.
  • support and monitor the follow-up implementation of corrective actions by management.
  • act as a resource for colleagues with less expertise.


who will you work with

  • Partners/communities within the IT operations and projects space
  • IT security, data protection, information security and business continuity communities within the Randstad organization.
  • Business risk & audit partners
  • IT & digital leadership
  • External co-source partners
  • BR &A F stakeholders/clients within the business including local MT's, process and control owners


what you will bring

Your in depth understanding and experience with general IT management processes, business enabling through it (automated controls, RPA and IA) combined with risk & audit skills are well developed. As a critical challenger to management you strike the right tone. You have a keen interest in enabling an effective balance in managing IT effectively while enabling the business to operate optimally leveraging IT. You have a sharp eye for improvements strengthening management controls structurally in the context of what works best within the company setting and not taking it from a theoretical perspective.

You:

  • have minimum 5 to 8 years of relevant experience
  • have at minimum a bachelor degree in IT, business or economics.
  • are qualified as IT auditor (e.G. CISA, RE or equivalent).

You work and act in a way that:

  • creates clarity - showing line of sight (analytical skills):
    you collect and analyze data to solve problems, make decisions and advice within your professional boundaries.
  • collaborates, reaches out (organizational sensitivity):
    maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization
  • ensures the business, thus:
    align, improve, execute and promote systems and work processes that support the business in achieving its goals and complies with internal and external standards and regulatory requirements.
  • co-drives the business, thus:
    provide insights into drivers for value creation and act as business partner in making decisions that enhance performance.
  • applies outside- in thinking (curiosity), with:
    unrest to push the boundary, eagerness, examination of new possibilities by investigating and asking questions, exploring and/or discovering new possibilities and assuming something better is still out there. You are comfortable leading what isn’t understood.


As IT auditor you:

  • have a strong independent mindset
  • are experienced in international stakeholder management & change
  • are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo

have an agile and flexible working style and passion for on the job coaching and development


Your competences demonstrates you can:

  • support the development of an audit universe and audit approaches on IT risks and opportunities, as well as assist in building cyber assurance practices within Randstad.
  • prepare audit plannings and scoping on identified (cyber) risks & opportunities.
  • lead and execute internal audits/review for operational business processes, with focus on cyber and give guidance and/or instructions to junior staff in audit projects.
  • report and communicate audit findings at the right tone to make impact and provide recommendations for improvements.


Your Business English is at level BEC B1/B2 or higher.

As the standard office locations for the BR&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, it is relevant, as part of the job, you are willing to travel. Travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.


your competencies

Within Randstad we defined the following Leadership competencies:

  • delighting people:
    connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client-centric solutions.
  • performing today:
    resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
  • leading change:
    manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
  • securing the future:
    drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.
  • strategic mindset:
    seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies
  • creating clarity - showing line of sight:
    making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
  • courage to challenge:
    shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances


what’s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here .


If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner:

title: Account Manager / Business Developer
description:

title: Logistics Operation Specialist
description:
Business Introduction

JD Industrials, a subsidiary of JD Group, focuses on industrial supply chain technologies and services, with a market capitalization of approximately $5 billion.

Our business is to support the development of enterprises from the industrial manufacturing industry through the integrated model of "supply chain + technology + service", and create a B to B procurement platform for industrial products. We provide industrial procurement solutions to more than 7,000 large customers and more than 8 million small and medium-sized business customers. We work with more than 30,000 suppliers of industrial goods, and our platform has more than 40 million SKUs .

Now JD Industrials focuses on developing overseas business, providing one-stop industrial product procurement solutions for enterprises from different countries. Our business has spread to Southeast Asia, Europe, the Middle East and South America .


Role Overview

We are looking for an expert in logistics supply chain operations to manage our fulfillment processes in Brazil.


Location:
 R. do Paraíso, 595 - 11o Andar - Paraíso, São Paulo - SP, 04103-001


Job Description

  1. Logistics management:

coordinate freight, distribution, distribution and other links, optimize logistics and information flow, and achieve efficient operation;

  1. Planmanagement:

manage the delivery of suppliers and the nodes of the internal fulfillment supply chain to meet the requirements of KA customers for timeliness;

  1. Costmanagement:

responsible for the cost review of transportation and distribution to ensure cost control and reasonable allocation of resources;

  1. Carrier management:

Responsible for establishing and maintaining good cooperative relations with various carriers, evaluating and selecting suitable carriers, and continuously optimizing to match business needs;

  1. Monitoring and exception management:

Monitor the operation status of the order in real time, find and deal with the abnormality in time to ensure the completion of the order fulfillment.

Qualifications

  1. More than 5 years of experience in B to B or B to C operation and distribution front-line operation and management;
  2. Experience in tripartite distribution management and local high-quality supplier resources;
  3. Proficient in data analysis, familiar with supply chain information system, able to use data analysis to optimize supply chain;
  4. Excellent communication and coordination skills and problem-solving skills able to independently lead and deal with various affairs;
  5. Fluent in English or Chinese.


Benefit

Leaves： 30 calendar days

Subsidies： Meal Allowance、Commuting Allowance、Telecommunication Reimbursement

Insurance & Wellbeing： Supplementary Life Insurance、Supplementary Accident Insurance、Supplementary Medical Insurance

Good team atmosphere

Laptops are provided by the company

title: Product It Sales Specialist
description:
Product Sales Specialist


Location:

Join Our Team and Drive Innovation in Cybersecurity!

Data Discovery, Data Privacy, Secure Software Development, Cloud Security, Data Loss Prevention, etc.


The ideal candidate will be a proactive professional with a balance of technical expertise and sales acumen, capable of conducting product presentations and demonstrations, engaging with customers, and supporting and collaborating with other sales team members to win the sale.


If you have a passion for technology, customer engagement, and driving product adoption, this is your opportunity to make a significant impact!


Key Responsibilities

Technical Sales Support


  • Assist in product evaluations, guiding customers through solution capabilities and answering technical inquiries.
  • Provide expert advice on Data Discovery, Data Privacy, Secure Software Development, Cloud Security, Compliance, etc.
  • Ensure that customers fully understand the value proposition and impact of the solutions.


Sales Enablement & Product Positioning

  • Develop a deep understanding of vendor solutions, their use cases, and business value.
  • Collaborate with the sales team to position cybersecurity solutions effectively, ensuring alignment with customer needs.
  • Deliver technical presentations and demonstrations in Portuguese, English, and Spanish to showcase product capabilities.
  • Track and report sales performance and provide insights to enhance sales execution and strategy.


Proposal Development & Market Intelligence

  • Support the preparation of RFPs, RFIs, and technical documentation tailored to customer requirements.
  • Monitor market trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in LATAM.
  • Gather customer feedback to enhance product positioning and sales strategies.


Internal Collaboration & Training

  • Train internal sales teams on the key features, differentiators, and strategic use cases of vendor solutions.
  • Work closely with vendors, partners, and internal stakeholders to maintain product knowledge and best practices.
  • Drive engagement across internal teams to ensure successful product adoption and integration.


Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Engineering, or related fields.
  • 3-5 years of experience in sales engineering/pre-sales, product management, or as a technical sales specialist within cybersecurity or technology solutions.


Technical & Sales Skills


Fluent in Portuguese (native), English, and Spanish.

Knowledge of Data Discovery, Data Privacy, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Secure Software Development, and/or Cloud Security.

Experience with RFP/RFI processes and technical proposal development.

Strong presentation, communication, and customer engagement skills.

Ability to conduct live product demonstrations and address customer concerns confidently.


Preferred Qualifications


Industry certifications (e.G., CompTIA Security+, CISSP, CISM, or CEH).

Experience working with channel partners, resellers, and vendor product sales. Ability to influence and motivate internal teams to support product positioning and adoption.


Why Join Us? Be part of a fast-growing team dedicated to delivering the best cybersecurity solutions to our clients. If you are ready to drive product adoption, support sales efforts, and engage with customers across LATAM, apply now and grow your career with GM Sectec !

title: Regional Operation Specialist
description:
Key Responsibilities:


1. Strategic Goal Management

  • Formulate comprehensive annual, quarterly, and monthly performance plans for the sales region in alignment with corporate - wide objectives.
  • Continuously monitor, collect, and analyze sales performance data across the region. Identify performance variances and develop actionable improvement strategies. Regularly present performance reports to senior management.


2. Customer Relationship Oversight

  • Routinely assess and ensure the sales department's adherence to established customer relationship management practices. Provide feedback and training as needed to enhance customer - facing activities.
  • Systematically track, measure, and report on sales leads, including the number of leads generated and conversion rates within the region. Provide insights to optimize lead management.


3. Lead and Opportunity Tracking

  • Establish and maintain an effective tracking system for leads and business opportunities. Regularly summarize and communicate the progress and status of lead nurturing and opportunity development to regional leadership.


4. Project Initiation and Evaluation

  • Thoroughly review the completeness and accuracy of project initiation materials for all relevant projects.
  • Organize and facilitate project initiation reviews for non - corporate - level projects, ensuring proper evaluation and decision - making.


5. Sales Project Management

  • Take charge of writing commercial bids for non - corporate - level projects and preparing comprehensive bid documents.
  • Timely provide bid - opening information and closely monitor the entire bidding process to ensure compliance and competitiveness.
  • Handle all aspects of contract management, including drafting, reviewing, and ensuring the integrity and enforce-ability of contracts.
  • Manage the invoicing process, payment collection, and actively follow up on overdue payments and bad debt situations.


6. Order Management and Logistics

  • Closely monitor and track the shipment and delivery progress of overseas orders. Proactively identify and resolve any issues or delays in the order fulfillment process.


7. Sales Forecasting and Reporting

  • Regularly collect, analyze, and consolidate regional sales forecast information. Provide accurate and timely forecasts to the headquarters to support strategic planning and resource allocation.


8. LTC Process Implementation and Optimization

  • Conduct in - depth training sessions on LTC process within the region to ensure proper implementation.
  • Continuously monitor the execution of LTC processes, identify bottlenecks or issues, and take corrective actions to optimize workflow.


9. Exhibition and Event Support

  • Provide professional front - desk services for exhibitions and trade shows, including managing customer lists and interactions.
  • Take the lead in handling customer reception and planning and executing various business events within the region.


10. Operational Support Activities

  • Assist in coordinating customer reception efforts and participate in both internal and external audit processes.


11. Administrative and Support Functions

  • Organize and manage department meetings, seminars, and other events. This includes comprehensive preparation, such as setting agendas, and thorough follow - up, such as distributing minutes.
  • Manage the document stamping process for sales - related documents, ensuring proper authorization. Assist the sales department with expense reimbursement procedures, ensuring compliance with corporate policies.
  • Oversee the proper distribution, archiving, and management of various departmental documents, ensuring easy retrieval and record - keeping.


Qualifications:

  • A bachelor's degree or higher in business, operations management, or a related field.
  • 1-3 years of relevant experience in regional operations, sales operations, or a similar role.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make informed decisions. Proficiency in data analysis techniques and tools is essential.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact with cross - functional teams.
  • Proficiency in English is an essential requirement. Chinese is also needed as a working language, and a good command of the local language in the region is highly preferred.
  • High proficiency in using office tools such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace. Familiarity with advanced features and functions to enhance productivity and streamline work processes.
  • Exceptional graduating students are also welcome to apply.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Join Us at Amcor:
Make a Global Impact!

At Amcor, we’re transforming the packaging industry to create a sustainable future. Our products impact the lives of millions every day across food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home and personal care, and other essential products. With a bold commitment to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025, we’re positioned to make a real difference in the lives of people worldwide. We have a proud history dating back to the 1860s, evolving from a single paper mill in Melbourne to the global leader in packaging. As a leading S&P 500 company with $13 billion in sales, we empower our 40,000 employees across 40 countries and 250 sites to innovate and excel.


For us, customer centricity is at the heart of everything we do. We believe in building strong, lasting relationships with our clients by truly understanding their needs and delivering solutions that exceed their expectations. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to work in a culture that prioritizes customer satisfaction, encourages innovation, and values your contributions in making a difference for our clients.


Position:
HR Manager (HRBP & Talent Development)


Job Overview:


We are looking for an experienced and strategic HR Manager (HRBP & Talent Development) to join our team. This role plays a key part in shaping our people strategy , acting as a trusted HR Business Partner for corporate leaders while also overseeing HR initiatives across multiple manufacturing plants.

A major focus of this position will be on Talent Management , driving initiatives such as leadership development, succession planning, performance management, employee engagement and talent acquisition . The remaining responsibilities involve HRBP duties , ensuring alignment between business goals and people strategies across both corporate and operational environments.

The ideal candidate has experience leading multi-plant HR operations , managing cross-functional teams, and implementing talent development programs that drive business success.


Key Responsibilities:

Talent Management & Leadership Development

  • Design and implement Talent Management strategies, ensuring strong leadership pipelines and employee growth opportunities.
  • Lead succession planning and talent reviews, working closely with senior leadership to identify and develop key talent.
  • Oversee leadership development programs , ensuring leaders at all levels are equipped to drive performance and engagement.
  • Develop and execute employee engagement and retention strategies to strengthen organizational culture.
  • Support organizational change initiatives, ensuring employees and leaders are aligned with business objectives.

HR Business Partnering & Multi-Plant Support

  • Act as a strategic HRBP for corporate leadership, advising on people strategies that align with business needs.
  • Provide HR leadership to multiple manufacturing plants , supporting local HR teams in driving workforce strategies.
  • Lead labor relations efforts, including union negotiations and compliance with local labor laws (CLT).
  • Drive HR operational excellence , overseeing recruitment, compensation, performance management, and workforce planning.
  • Ensure compliance with corporate policies, local labor regulations, and best HR practices .


Skills:

· Strong expertise in Talent Management, Leadership Development, and Succession Planning .

· Proven experience as an HR Business Partner in a corporate and manufacturing environment.

· Experience managing multi-plant HR operations with remote leadership capabilities.

· Solid understanding of Brazilian labor laws (CLT), labor reform, and related jurisprudence .

· Financial and budget management skills.


Competencies:


· Strategic Thinking & Business Acumen

· Employee Engagement & Culture Building

· Customer Focus & Stakeholder Management


Qualifications:


· Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Law, Psychology, or related fields.

· MBA or Postgraduate degree in Human Resources or People Management is preferred.

· Fluent English (mandatory).

· Spanish is a plus .

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite .


At Amcor, we are stronger because of the diversity of talents, styles, cultures, and experiences within our team. Different perspectives lead to diverse solutions, which are essential for our success and innovation. We are a global team where everyone has a voice and can make a difference.


If you’re ready to make an impact in a thriving global organization, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Senior Marketing Analyst - New Games
description:
About Garena:

Established in 2009 and headquartered in Singapore, Garena is a leading online games developer and publisher with a global footprint across more than 130 markets.


Garena provides global users access to popular and engaging mobile and PC online games that it develops, curates, and localizes. It champions games as a social and entertainment platform on which its communities can engage and interact.


In addition, Garena is a leading esports organizer. It hosts esports events around the world that range from grassroots local tournaments to some of the most viewed professional esports competitions globally. The Free Fire World Series 2021 Singapore, which was watched by 5.4 million concurrent viewers at its peak, holds the record for the highest concurrent viewership of any esports match in history.


About the position:

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst who will be responsible for driving the success of our marketing campaign performance and providing valuable insights to drive successful marketing strategies for New Games.


If you are a driven person who wants to contribute to the gaming industry, we’d love to work with you!


Make sure to share your CV in English.


Responsibilities:

  • Campaigns:
    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the successful launch of game updates. Assist in creating marketing plans, coordinating promotional activities, and monitoring launch performance. Identify key metrics, track campaign effectiveness and provide insights to optimize future marketing strategies.
  • Event Coordination:
    Coordinate events and activities to increase awareness about our brand.
  • Data Analysis and Reporting:
    Establish a robust system for monitoring and reporting KPIs related to marketing initiatives. Regularly track and analyze metrics such as customer acquisition costs, conversion rates, player engagement, and revenue. Provide reports and insights to stakeholders to assess marketing performance and identify areas for improvement.
  • Industry Benchmarking and Trend Monitoring:
    Stay updated with gaming industry trends, popular games and emerging influencers to identify collaboration opportunities.
  • Effectively communicate findings, recommendations and campaign results to stakeholders and team members through verbal and written reports.



Main job requirements:

  • Completed bachelor degree in Marketing, Administration or similar courses;
  • Solid experience working in a Marketing-related role;
  • Strong knowledge of the mobile gaming industry;
  • Desirable experience on analytics tools and programming, Office Suite and social listening tools;
  • Strong interpersonal skills;
  • Full professional competency in both written and spoken Portuguese and English;
  • Passionate about the gaming universe;
  • Available to work in person at our office in São Paulo, SP.

title: Denim Modeling
description:
DENIM Modeling


ABOUT SHEIN:


SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!


CAREERS AT SHEIN:


We Commit to Inclusion


We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.


We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers


At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.


We Engage with Global Cultures


SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide, providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.


Responsabilities:


● Develop and establish the company's sample review standards through customer feedback and market positioning. Collaborate with designers to develop and research patterns, create denim patterns, and manage fiting improvement during the design phase (such as fabric anomalies, technical anomalies, size anomalies, etc.).

● Review the fit, size, appearance, and sewing details of supplier samples according to the company's sample review requirements.

● Be responsible for documenting and communicating the contents of the sample review, effectively describing any issues with the samples and proposing feasible modification plans.

● Be proficient in denim processes, able to conduct sample reviews and provide improvement suggestions, follow up on customer complaints data, and formulate, execute, and verify quality improvement plans.

● For factories with high sample revision rates:
Assist in adjusting factory patterns and reissuing patterns (a firm requirement is to be able to create patterns), and produce corresponding size orders based on the company's sample review requirements and style images.


Requirements:


1. Experience in the Denim apparel industry with at least 5 years of quality management/sample review experience in denim.

2. Experience with well-known denim clothing companies is preferred.

3. Familiarity with denim processes and industry testing standards, proficiency in the characteristics of denim fabrics and accessories, testing/production processes, and familiarity with denim manufacturing and quality management processes.

4. Understanding of pattern-making, and experience in sewing board production is preferred.

5. A certain level of market awareness and economic perspective, along with good communication skills, organizational coordination.

6. Proficiency in English.


At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

title: Fashion Print Designer
description:
Fashion Print Designer:


We are seeking a fashion Print Designer who is proficient in English, adaptable, and willing to learn a new way of creating. The primary responsibility of this role will be to create original artworks and adapt best seller artworks for SHEIN resort collection.


Key Responsibilities:


● Completing monthly development requirements for series line prints, working closely with planners and other designers to implement adjustment

● Designing original print patterns according to company brand positioning (full print and placement print)

● Extending print pattern designs based on company's bestselling prints.

● Help collect and analyze print trends to plan and propose relevant patterns.

● Maintaining and organizing the pattern library.

● Do Product mockups.


Job Requirements:


● Minimum 2 years of experience in garment pattern design, with familiarity with resort women's wear style and expertise in printing techniques and processes.

● Proficiency in design software including Photoshop and Illustrator, along with great hand-drawing skills.

● Understanding of resort women's wear pattern styles and the ability to independently match styles based on patterns to fulfill development tasks.

● Strong communication, written expression, language organization, coordination, and logical thinking skills. Advanced or Fluent in English.

● Clear work approach, proactive attitude, and excellent collaboration and teamwork skills.

● Diligence, efficiency, responsibility, meticulousness, and the ability to handle work pressures effectively.

● Strong aesthetic sense and innovative abilities.


At Shein, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

title: Senior Logistics Specialist
description:
Business Introduction

JD Industrials, a subsidiary of JD Group, focuses on industrial supply chain technologies and services, with a market capitalization of approximately $5 billion.Our business is to support the development of enterprises from the industrial manufacturing industry through the integrated model of "supply chain + technology + service", and create a B to B procurement platform for industrial products. We provide industrial procurement solutions to more than 7,000 large customers and more than 8 million small and medium-sized business customers. We work with more than 30,000 suppliers of industrial goods, and our platform has more than 40 million SKUs .

Now JD Industrials focuses on developing overseas business, providing one-stop industrial product procurement solutions for enterprises from different countries. Our business has spread to Southeast Asia, Europe, the Middle East and South America .


Role Overview

We are looking for an expert in logistics supply chain operations to manage our fulfillment processes in Brazil.


Location:
 R. do Paraíso, 595 - 11o Andar - Paraíso, São Paulo - SP, 04103-001


Job Description

  1. Logistics management:
    coordinate freight, distribution, distribution and other links, optimize logistics and information flow, and achieve efficient operation;
  2. Plan management:
    manage the delivery of suppliers and the nodes of the internal fulfillment supply chain to meet the requirements of KA customers for timeliness;
  3. Cost management:
    responsible for the cost review of transportation and distribution to ensure cost control and reasonable allocation of resources;
  4. Carriermanagement:
     Responsible for establishing and maintaining good cooperative relations with various carriers, evaluating and selecting suitable carriers, and continuously optimizing to match business needs;
  5. Monitoring and exception management:
     Monitor the operation status of the order in real time, find and deal with the abnormality in time to ensure the completion of the order fulfillment.

Qualifications

  1. More than 5 years of experience in B to B or B to C operation and distribution front-line operation and management;
  2. Experience in tripartite distribution management and local high-quality supplier resources;
  3. Proficient in data analysis, familiar with supply chain information system, able to use data analysis to optimize supply chain;
  4. Excellent communication and coordination skills and problem-solving skills able to independently lead and deal with various affairs;
  5. Fluent in English or Chinese.


Benefit

Leaves： 30 calendar days

Subsidies： Meal Allowance、Commuting Allowance、Telecommunication Reimbursement

Insurance & Wellbeing： Supplementary Life Insurance、Supplementary Accident Insurance、Supplementary Medical Insurance

Good team atmosphere and many opportunities for promotion

Laptops are provided by the company

title: Data Engineer
description:
dunnhumby is the global leader in Customer Data Science, empowering businesses everywhere to compete and thrive in the modern data-driven economy. We always put the Customer First.


Our mission :
to enable businesses to grow and reimagine themselves by becoming advocates and champions for their Customers. With deep heritage and expertise in retail – one of the world’s most competitive markets, with a deluge of multi-dimensional data – dunnhumby today enables businesses all over the world, across industries, to be Customer First


dunnhumby employs nearly 2,500 experts in offices throughout Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas working for transformative, iconic brands such as Tesco, Coca-Cola, Meijer, Procter & Gamble and Metro.


We are looking for a talented Data Engineer To execute big data projects to create ready-to-use science products or software modules, engineering dunnhumby science into automated and scalable solutions available to capabilities teams. Developing the bog data back-end for science products and reusable science modules, ensuring they are productionised and available to the business and keeping in mind that developed solutions have to distil complex problems into compelling insights that resonate with clients. Working with senior data science engineers to conduct requirements analysis and design the solution. Input into reengineering and design based on own expertise and implement advice from colleagues to resolve challenge and create big data back-ends for highly performant Business Intelligence applications for desktop platforms.


What are we expecting from you

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in an engineering/numerate subject e.G. Engineering, Stats, Math, Computer Science.
  • Experience with and passion for building back-end workflows and applications using modern technologies, and an appetite for understanding and implementing data science algorithms.
  • Would need to be a quick learner as some of the components of the tech stack could change
  • Backend stack:
    Python, Pyspark, SQL coding.
  • Strong programming skills in Python (including OOP)
  • At least 2 years of back-end development using Pyspark, HDFS, Hive, any cloud platform.
  • Good knowledge of SQL (joins, subqueries, etc.) and optimization techniques
  • Knowledge of general software design, architecture and best practices
  • Advanced English proficiency


What you can expect from us

We won’t just meet your expectations. We’ll defy them. So you’ll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you’d expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.


You’ll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and

learn. And we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day – with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone’s invited.


Our approach to Flexible

Working at dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work. We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

title: Customer Relationship Management Manager
description:
We are looking for a super experienced CRM professional to manage all CRM campaigns in Brazil for the Hair Loss category from strategy to execution. You will own acquisition, retention and transactional communications by email, SMS and whatsapp channels. This position will be part of the Global CRM team and report to the CRM lead in the UK.


RESPONSIBILITIES :

  • Building, managing and reporting all Brazilian Hair Loss CRM campaigns through Customer.Io platform;
  • Translate business objectives into CRM strategies to bring increasingly effective results in customer acquisition and retention;
  • Build, manage and report tests to ensure continuous improvement on actual CRM performance campaigns, such as cart abandonment, churn recovery, prospecting, promotions and member get member
  • Continuous review of the user communication journey in order to decrease number of contacts (tickets) and making the experience smoother
  • Working closely (daily interaction) with UK team to ensure alignment on global strategy and best practices shared


REQUIREMENTS:

  • Fluent english
  • Flawless writing skills in PT
  • At least 4 years of experience with CRM platforms such as Customer.Io, Braze, Salesforce and/or others
  • Intermediate/Advanced HTML knowledge
  • Very analytical profile, able to build reports and track performance
  • Ability to carry out strategic analysis of the customer journey and propose actions to meet or improve business objectives
  • Experience on creative development with the copy/design team, building briefs and processes to drive content production


WORK MODEL AND BENEFITS:

  • PJ contract, hybrid work model (São Paulo - SP).
  • Stock options.
  • Amil health insurance with co-participation.
  • Gympass.
  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment.

title: Strategy & Operations Manager
description:
We are seeking a Strategy & Operations Manager to drive the implementation of strategic projects for our operations in Brazil. In this role, you will be accountable for designing and implementing some of the most impactful projects of our business, as well as helping us enhance problem-solving skills within the team.


This is an ideal role for professionals with strong problem-solving skills who want to challenge themselves in a fast-paced environment and manage high impact projects to improve patient experience, scale our operations, help expanding categories and guarantee financial sustainability. If you like to go deep into cross-company problems and solve them by implementing solutions you define with our teams, this role is for you!


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Solve problems :
    Collaborate with colleagues from several teams to identify and address operational challenges, with a focus on designing, implementing, and scaling processes
  • Drive operational excellence :
    Guarantee quality of our operations through supply chain, patient experience and financial management best practices
  • Expand our business :
    Work with Category, Product and Tech teams (among others) to design and implement operational processes to enable the launch of new business categories
  • Build and innovate :
    Develop and experiment with new approaches, utilising data-driven insights to continuously refine and optimise solutions
  • Learn and iterate :
    Assess both operational and financial implications of initiatives, leveraging insights to iterate and improve strategies over time


BENEFITS

  • Generous stock option plan
  • Private medical insurance plan (Amil S750)
  • Access to English learning platform with 1 class hour per week
  • Gym and wellness benefit with Wellhub
  • Hybrid role based in São Paulo, with 1 week per month of in-person working (usually last week of the month)
  • 22 business days of vacation
  • A growing team with plenty of opportunities for progression, ownership of goals and a direct impact to MANUAL
  • Join in the early stages of one of the most promising start-ups in the health & wellness space



JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • You have 5+ years of experience in Operations, Strategy, Customer Experience or other related areas
  • You have analytics experience in collecting data, building forecasting models and defining performance tracking to measure the success of your initiatives
  • You have bias for action and a track record of leading initiatives, hitting goals, and succeeding in a cross-functional team environment
  • You bring structure, organisation, and focus to your work and work with cross-functional teams, including Operations, Product, Tech, Marketing, Finance, and Legal
  • You have experience as a people manager, which includes leading development conversations, helping with prioritisation and providing constructive feedback
  • Having worked as a strategic consultant is a plus

title: Key Account Manager/Sales Executive At Joompro
description:
JoomPro is a first end-to-end cross-border B2B marketplace. We aspire to create a new level of service in the wholesale purchasing market and give everyone, anywhere in the world, the opportunity to easily and efficiently order goods from factories in China, with plans to include India, Bangladesh, Turkey, and others in the future.


JoomPro is one of the key businesses of Joom, an international group of e-commerce companies founded in 2016 in Latvia. Joom also includes other businesses:
Joom Marketplace, a platform for global shopping;
Onfy, a pharmaceutical marketplace in Germany;
and Joom Pulse, a data platform that provides analytics and recommendations for marketplace sellers. Joom has offices in Latvia, China, Hong Kong, the USA, Germany, Brazil, and Portugal, with its headquarters in Lisbon, Portugal.


JoomPro is entering a rapid expansion phase and we are now looking for a Key Account Manager/Sales Executive who will be responsible for acquiring new large clients for JoomPro Brazil.


Responsibilities:


  • Lead efforts to identify, engage, and secure large clients for JoomPro Brazil, building strong and lasting relationships
  • Design and maintain a robust outbound prospecting pipeline to drive consistent growth
  • Oversee the entire acquisition process — from curating prospect lists and managing the sales funnel to closing high-value deals
  • Work closely with Sales Excellence, Supply, Logistics, and Marketing teams to optimize prospecting activities and ensure a seamless client experience


Requirements:


  • Proven track record in active prospecting of large clients in complex sales environments
  • Proficiency in B2B Outbound prospecting tools such as Lusha, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Hunter, Cortex, Ramper, Clearbit, among others
  • Skilled in using CRM systems like Hubspot, Salesforce, Pipedrive, etc.
  • Deep understanding of B2B sales processes, prospecting funnel control, pipeline setup, and conversion by funnel stage
  • Ability to independently build, organize, and manage your own prospecting portfolio with minimal oversight
  • Familiarity with leading sales frameworks such as BANT, SPIN, among others
  • Advanced English


We are offering:


  • CLT employment with all benefits according Brazil labour law
  • Flexible working hours and 22 days of paid annual leave
  • Extended health insurance for the employees, their spouses, and children, including dental care coverage
  • 100% paid sick leaves
  • Personal development:
    professional events, workshops, English classes, corporate library
  • Daily meal allowance
  • Annual team retreats


Before applying for the above position please review our Candidate Privacy Notice here:
/>//legal.Joom.Com/recruitment/JoomPro_Brazil_Job_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.Pdf By responding to the vacancy, you acknowledge that you have read our Privacy notice.

title: Marketing Campaign Specialist - Free Fire
description:
About Garena:

Established in 2009 and headquartered in Singapore, Garena is a leading online games developer and publisher with a global footprint across more than 130 markets.


Garena provides global users access to popular and engaging mobile and PC online games that it develops, curates, and localizes. It champions games as a social and entertainment platform on which its communities can engage and interact.


In addition, Garena is a leading esports organizer. It hosts esports events around the world that range from grassroots local tournaments to some of the most viewed professional esports competitions globally. The Free Fire World Series 2021 Singapore, which was watched by 5.4 million concurrent viewers at its peak, holds the record for the highest concurrent viewership of any esports match in history.


About the position:

We are looking for a Marketing Campaign Specialist who will be responsible for driving the success of our marketing campaign performance and providing valuable insights to drive successful marketing strategies for Free Fire.


If you are a driven person who wants to contribute to the gaming industry, we’d love to work with you!


Make sure to share your CV in English.


Responsibilities:

  • Campaigns:
    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the successful launch of game updates or actions. Assist in creating marketing plans, coordinating promotional activities, and monitoring launch performance. Identify key metrics, track campaign effectiveness, and provide insights to optimize future marketing strategies.
  • Event | Campaign Coordination:
    Coordinate events, campaigns, and activities to increase awareness about our brand. Manage project progress including project quality control, coordinate with related teams and partners, material development, project follow up as well as internal financial and legal process.
  • Data Analysis and Reporting:
    Establish a robust system for monitoring and reporting KPIs related to marketing initiatives. Regularly track and analyze metrics. Provide reports and insights to stakeholders to assess marketing performance and identify areas for improvement.
  • Industry Benchmarking and Trend Monitoring:
    Stay updated with gaming industry trends and popular games to identify collaboration opportunities and campaigns suggestions.
  • Feedback Collection:
    Collect feedback regarding the game, updates, actions, campaigns, and news. Effectively communicate findings, recommendations, and campaign results to stakeholders and team members through verbal and written reports.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration:
    Collaborate closely with other teams within the communication and branding department, including global teams, to develop high-impact initiatives and activations. Work together to enhance the overall player experience and maximize the impact of Free Fire's presence within the community.



Main job requirements:

  • Completed higher education (preferred in Advertising, Marketing or Communications);
  • Solid experience working with campaigns, marketing, community, or communications, preferably in the gaming industry or entertainment;
  • Previous experience with data analysis and reports;
  • Strong knowledge of the mobile gaming industry;
  • Desirable experience project management tools, such as Favro/Monday/Trello;
  • Full professional competency in both written and spoken Portuguese and English;
  • Passionate about the gaming universe;
  • Available to work in person at our office in São Paulo, SP.

title: Logistics Channel Development Manager
description:
ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. title: Junior Visual Designer - Free Fire
description:
About Garena:

Established in 2009 and headquartered in Singapore, Garena is a leading online games developer and publisher with a global footprint across more than 130 markets.


Garena provides global users access to popular and engaging mobile and PC online games that it develops, curates, and localizes. It champions games as a social and entertainment platform on which its communities can engage and interact.

The Free Fire World Series 2021 Singapore, which was watched by 5.4 million concurrent viewers at its peak, holds the record for the highest concurrent viewership of any esports match in history.

title: Tax Coordinator
description:
About Us:

OPPO is a global leader in innovative technology, known for its relentless pursuit of aesthetic perfection. OPPO partners with top-tier global enterprises and platforms such as Google, UEFA Champions League, and Discovery.

title: Logistics Service Excellence-Team Leader
description:
ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!


CAREERS AT SHEIN


We Commit to Inclusion

At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.


We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.


We Engage with Global Cultures

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide, providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.



ABOUT THE ROLE：

The Logistics Service Excellence Leader will be responsible for ensuring excellence in logistics processes and customer service management at SHEIN, acting as the bridge between operational logistics teams and customer service teams that assist buyers and sellers on the platform. This role is critical in continuously improving service levels, enhancing the customer experience, and driving operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Ticket and Complaint Management:
     Coordinate the management of logistics-related tickets, acting as the main point of contact between operational teams and customer service teams. Ensure effective and timely resolution of tickets, prioritizing issues that directly impact customers.
  • Interface with 3PLs and Logistics Partners:
     Work closely with 3PLs (Third-Party Logistics) and other logistics partners to ensure all logistics-related demands and issues are addressed with high priority and efficiency, promoting ongoing alignment with SHEIN’s service standards.
  • Service Level Indicator (SLA) Improvement:
     Lead the analysis and improvement of key service level indicators (SLAs), based on complaints and feedback from customers. Use data and metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement effective action plans.
  • Process and Operational Control Improvement:
     Collaborate with logistics operational teams to promote improvements in internal processes, focusing on reducing errors and increasing efficiency in ticket handling. Help implement control processes that ensure consistency and quality in the services provided.
  • Coordination with Other Departments:
     Act as the point of contact between logistics and other departments such as marketing, product, among others, to identify logistical solutions that meet the specific needs of each department, ensuring logistics alignment with the company’s overall objectives.
  • Continuous Improvement Implementation:
     Promote the implementation of continuous improvement methodologies, focusing on processes and systems that enhance the customer experience and operational efficiency. Use tools and methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or others to identify and eliminate inefficiencies.
  • Customer Feedback Management:
     Lead initiatives focused on analyzing the root causes of complaints, seeking not only quick solutions but also structural improvements to prevent recurrence.



Qualifications:

  • Academic Background:
     Bachelor's degree in related fields such as Business Administration, Logistics, Industrial Engineering, or similar. A postgraduate degree or MBA in Logistics, Service Management, or related fields will be a plus.
  • Fluency in English:
     Effective communication in English is essential, as the role involves interaction with international teams and partners.
  • Experience in Ticket and Complaint Management:
     Solid experience in CRM, ticket management, feedback analysis, and customer issue resolution.
  • Logistics Knowledge:
     Practical experience in logistics, preferably in e-commerce platforms, marketplaces, or B2C carriers, with an understanding of transportation operations and supply chain dynamics.
  • Continuous Improvement Skills:
     Familiarity with continuous improvement methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma, Kaizen, etc.), with the ability to identify problems and implement structured solutions.
  • Analytical Mindset and Data Orientation:
     Ability to analyze performance data and use KPIs to identify areas for improvement. Focus on results and enhancing the customer experience.
  • Interpersonal Skills:
     Ability to interact with various stakeholders both inside and outside the company, fostering a collaborative and effective approach across all organizational levels.
  • Leadership Experience:
     Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage projects focused on service improvement, always aligned with customer needs.

Desirable:

  • Experience in high-demand environments such as e-commerce companies.
  • Knowledge of ticket management platforms and CRM (Zendesk, Freshdesk, Salesforce, etc.).
  • Experience working with logistics-specific KPIs and SLAs in customer service.

title: Manager - Consulting
description:
Company Overview


GEP is a diverse, creative team of people passionate about procurement. We invest ourselves entirely in our client’s success, creating strong collaborative relationships that deliver extraordinary value year after year. title: Lead Engineer, Dtc
description:
Kenvue is currently recruiting for:

Lead Engineer, DTC


Who we are

At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion;
care is our talent. Ourglobal team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours. For more information, click here.


What you will do

Responsible for Engineering our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) team enabling the growth of our brands in line with the company's overall goals and objectives to grow our DTC eCommerce business. This position reports into the Engineering Manager, DTC and is based at Sao Paolo, Brazil.


Key Responsibilities

  • Your main responsibility will revolve around our 4 core Shopify stores:
    Rogaine, Neostrata, Exuviance and Versalie.
  • As part of a cross-functional agile software team, you will design, implement, and maintain our ecommerce systems (i.E., Shopify)
  • Actively participate in Product-led Agile ceremonies (e.G., Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming) and facilitate the Engineering-led meetings (e.G. Daily Stand Up)
  • Work closely with software developers and QA team to deliver best design and implementation of features within the team
  • Conduct frequent code review, unit testing and continuous improvement
  • Collect, analyze and report required software development metrics needed to assess team performance and areas for improvement
  • Provide technical oversight, making modifications to existing software and integrating applications and services in collaboration with leadership
  • Assist in identification and implementation of short-term and long-term technical and software solutions to business needs, including risk assessments and recommendations to business and technology leadership
  • Design, implement, and support website availability monitors (e.G., external uptime monitoring, transactional monitoring) in coordination with the Kenvue site reliability team
  • Partner with the Product and Platform team to understand their roadmap and planned features, ensuring Engineering backlog is represented in the broader Product backlog
  • Have the capability to work independently, taking ownership of problems
  • Help with the mentoring and coaching of junior team members
  • Accountable for high quality delivery
  • Own the documentation of our tech stack


What we are looking for

Required Qualifications

  • 4+ years software development experience with a variety of languages
  • 1+ years people management experience
  • Ecommerce software development and solutions experience
  • Shopify storefront development using Shopify themes (i.E., fullstack)
  • Competence with software development tools, including IDEs, source code management systems, and build/deploy tools
  • Comprehensive understanding of Git version control system and concepts
  • Strong working knowledge of modern API integration methodologies (e.G., REST, RESTful, GraphQL, etc) and associated modern authentication mechanisms (e.G., OAuth 2)
  • Decision maker mindset -- comfortable making timely and definitive decisions with confidence to help others understand and implement according to the decision made


What’s in it for you

  • Competitive Total Rewards Package*
  • Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!
  • Learning & Development Opportunities
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • This list could vary based on location/region


*Note:
Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.


Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Marketing And Events Specialist - Brand Experience
description:
Marketing and Events Specialist - Brand Experience:


ABOUT SHEIN:


SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!


ABOUT THE ROLE:


SHEIN's Brand Experience area is responsible for all the brand's offline activations and sponsorships, creating innovative experiences that bring SHEIN closer to its public in a tangible and memorable way. Among its main deliveries are the pop-up stores, one of the brand's biggest successes in Brazil and around the world.


The SHEIN pop-up concept goes beyond a temporary store;
they are true hubs of experience, where fashion, interactivity and technology meet. Each edition is carefully planned to reflect the brand's identity, featuring a varied product mix, instagrammable spaces and exclusive activations that create a unique connection with consumers.


As well as providing direct access to SHEIN products, the pop-ups are designed to strengthen relationships with the local public, highlighting cultural elements and regional trends. All of this is in line with SHEIN's commitment to offering fashion that is accessible, diverse and connected to its consumers' lifestyles.


Main responsibilities:


- Management of pop-up stores and events:

Plan, execute and manage the operation of temporary stores and other offline events with SHEIN brand activation, ensure that activities have an impact and strengthen the brand according to the KPIs pursued.

Coordinate partner suppliers, internal teams and stakeholders to ensure successful delivery of projects.


- Offline media planning:

Manage, monitor and negotiate offline media, including channel selection, out off home media delivering campaign effectiveness.

Working in partnership with the social media team, ensuring a unified strategy that promotes the customer journey on our platform.


- Project management and execution:

Managing the area's projects so that all stakeholders are directed towards the same strategy.

Autonomous profile and ownership in project management, defining strategy, execution and measuring results.


- Data analysis:

Analytical profile for evaluating all the area's projects, reach, ROI, brand recognition, customer satisfaction and target audiences.


Qualifications:


- Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business Administration, Communications or related field.

- More than five years' experience in offline marketing, preferably in the fashion, retail or marketplace sector.

- Experience in managing and executing physical events.

- Experience in project management.

- Experience in traditional media management.

- Advanced/Fluent English


At Shein, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

title: Marketing Manager - Kol And Strategic Campaigns
description:
Marketing Manager - KOL and Strategic Campaigns


The Strategic Campaigns & KOL area is a key part of our Marketing team, responsible for planning, structuring and executing high-impact campaigns on mass media channels (TV and OOH) and social media (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok) and managing/negotiating partnerships with influencers relevant to SHEIN. Our team works in a multidisciplinary way, coordinating with areas such as Content, Brand Experience, PR, GR and Marketplace to ensure integrated, consistent and results-oriented communication. In addition, we are responsible for structuring and executing content strategies, analyzing performance metrics and optimizing return on investment, contributing directly to strengthening and expanding our brand presence in different markets in Brazil.


Key Responsibilities:


1. Seasonal & Big Promotional Campaigns


- Planning and Execution of Big Promotions

o Develop strategies for high-impact campaigns aligned with brand goals and market trends.

o Managing budgets and schedules, coordinating internal teams and external suppliers.

- Multichannel (Media & TV)

o Plan, produce and execute campaigns across different channels, including social media, TV, OOH and other offline media.

o Ensuring the integration of all touchpoints to maximize the impact of the campaign.


2. KOL Management & Analysis


- Identifying and collaborating with KOLs

o Select KOLs aligned with the brand.

o Negotiate exclusive collaborations or special collections with high-performance KOLs.

- Performance Analysis

o Evaluate the performance of each KOL (engagement, reach, ROI, GMV).

o Optimize strategies to improve impact and results, with a focus on engagement and sales.

- Metrics & KPIs

o Monitor ROI results, engagement, conversion rate and other relevant indicators.

o Generate periodic analyses and data-based recommendations to optimize campaigns in real time.

- Reports and Feedback

o Prepare executive presentations for stakeholders, highlighting learnings and insights for

future campaigns.


3. Campaign Briefing & Execution


- Brief creation

o Develop detailed briefs for internal teams (creatives, media, etc.) and external suppliers.

o Aligning objectives, themes and schedules, ensuring visual and message uniformity.

- Production supervision

o Monitor the entire production process (shooting, recording, editing), ensuring quality and deadlines.


4. Brand Consistency


- Maintaining Standards

o Ensuring consistency and cohesion in brand representation across all campaigns and channels.

o Overseeing the application of style guides and visual identity.


5. Stakeholder & Cross-Functional Coordination


- Supporting Internal Teams

o Acting as a focal point for aligning priorities and executing activities.

o Coordinating deadlines and resources, ensuring synergy between teams from different time zones and cultures.

- External Partnerships

o Develop relationships with production suppliers, media agencies and broadcast platforms.


Qualifications & Requirements:


o Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Administration, Communication or related field.

o 5+ years in marketing campaign management, including influencer/KOL initiatives and large-scale campaigns.

o Experience in media production (TV, video, OOH) and coordination of suppliers/studios.

o Previous work in international contexts or with global teams is a plus.

o Fluent English (written and spoken) - essential for global interfaces.

o Solid knowledge of digital marketing, social media and market trends.

o Excellence in data analysis and metrics for campaign optimization and KOL performance.

o Leadership of cross-functional teams.

o Organization and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines.

o Strategic vision and creative thinking.

o Communication and relationship skills with internal and external stakeholders.

o Adaptability and problem-solving in dynamic environments
